[[File:Kliffende, Island Sylt, 1999.jpg|thumb|upright=1.1|Geotextile sandbags protected the historic house Kliffende on [[Sylt]] island against storms, which eroded the cliffs left and right from the sandbag barrier.<ref name=geo>{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1088/1468-6996/16/3/034605|pmid=27877792|pmc=5099829| title = Geosynthetics in geoenvironmental engineering| journal = Science and Technology of Advanced Materials| volume = 16| issue = 3| pages = 034605| year = 2015| last1 = Müller | first1 = W. W. | last2 = Saathoff | first2 = F. |bibcode=2015STAdM..16c4605M}}</ref>]] [[File:Mega sand container.jpg|thumb|upright=1.1|Geotextile sandbags can be ca. 20 m long, such as those used for the artificial reef at [[Narrow Neck, Queensland]].<ref name=geo/>]] '''Geotextiles''' are permeable [[fabric]]s which, when used in association with [[soil]], have the ability to separate, filter, reinforce, protect, or drain. Typically made from [[polypropylene]] or [[polyester]], geotextile fabrics come in three basic forms: woven (resembling mail bag sacking), needle punched (resembling [[felt]]), or heat bonded (resembling ironed felt).
Geotextile composites have been introduced and products such as [[geogrid]]s and meshes have been developed. Geotextiles are able to withstand many things, are durable, and are able to soften a fall if someone falls down. Overall, these materials are referred to as [[geosynthetics]] and each configuration—[[geonets]], [[geosynthetic clay liner]]s, geogrids, geotextile tubes, and others—can yield benefits in [[geotechnical engineering|geotechnical]] and [[environmental engineering]] design.
==History== Geotextiles were originally intended to be an alternative to granular [[soil]] filters. The original, and still sometimes used, term for geotextiles is ''filter fabrics''. Work originally began in the 1950s with R.J. Barrett using geotextiles behind precast concrete seawalls, under precast concrete [[erosion control]] blocks, beneath large stone riprap, and in other erosion control situations.<ref>Barrett, R. J., "Use of Plastic Filters in Coastal Structures," Proceedings from the 16th International Conference Coastal Engineers, Tokyo, September 1966, pp. 1048–1067</ref> He used different styles of woven monofilament fabrics, all characterized by a relatively high percentage open area (varying from 6 to 30%). He discussed the need for both adequate permeability and soil retention, along with adequate fabric strength and proper elongation and set the tone for geotextile use in [[filtration]] situations.
==Applications== [[File:Silt fence EPA.jpg|thumb|upright=1.1|A [[silt fence]] on a construction site.]] Geotextiles and related products have many applications and currently support many [[civil engineering]] applications including [[road]]s, [[airfield]]s, [[railroad]]s, [[Embankment (transportation)|embankments]], [[retaining structure]]s, [[reservoir]]s, [[canal]]s, [[dam]]s, [[Stream bed|bank]] protection, [[coastal engineering]] and [[construction]] site [[silt fence]]s or geotube. Usually geotextiles are placed at the tension surface to strengthen the soil. Geotextiles are also used for sand [[dune]] armoring to protect upland coastal property from storm surge, wave action and flooding. A large sand-filled container (SFC) within the dune system prevents storm [[erosion]] from proceeding beyond the SFC. Using a sloped unit rather than a single tube eliminates damaging scour.
[[Erosion control]] manuals comment on the effectiveness of sloped, stepped shapes in mitigating shoreline erosion damage from storms. Geotextile sand-filled units provide a "soft" armoring solution for upland property protection. Geotextiles are used as matting to stabilize flow in stream channels and [[bioswale|swales]].<ref name="Dane Co">{{Cite report |title=Dane County Erosion Control and Stormwater Management Manual |url=http://www.danewaters.com/pdf/manual/ecsm_manual.pdf |author=Dane County Department of Land and Water Resources |last= |first= |coauthors= |year=2007 |publisher=Madison, WI |accessdate=2010-02-09 |docket= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite report |title=Massachusetts Erosion and Sediment Control Guidelines for Urban and Suburban Areas |url=http://www.mass.gov/eea/docs/dep/water/esfull.pdf |author=Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection |coauthors= |year=2003 |publisher= |location=Boston, MA |accessdate= |docket= }} pp. 73–74.</ref>
Geotextiles can improve soil strength at a lower cost than conventional [[soil nailing]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=Slope Stabilization and Erosion Control: A Bioengineering Approach|last=Morgan|first=Roy P.C.|last2=Rickson|first2=R.J.|publisher=Taylor & Francis|year=2011|isbn=9780419156307|location=London|pages=}}</ref> In addition, geotextiles allow planting on steep slopes, further securing the slope.
Geotextiles have been used to protect the fossil [[hominid]] footprints of [[Laetoli]] in [[Tanzania]] from [[erosion]], [[rain]], and [[tree]] [[root]]s.<ref>Renfrew, Colin and Paul Bahn, ''Archaeology''. 4th ed. New York: Thames 2004. {{ISBN|978-0-500-28441-4}}. {{page needed|date=October 2011}}</ref>
In building [[demolition]], geotextile fabrics in combination with steel wire fencing can contain explosive debris.<ref name = "NOVA1">{{cite web |author=WGBH Boston |title=Interview with Stacey Loizeaux |url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/kaboom/loizeaux.html |work=[[Nova (TV series)|NOVA Online]] |publisher=Public Broadcasting Service |date=December 1996 |accessdate=2009-04-29 |quote=Other preparatory operations involve covering/wrapping the columns first with chain link fences and then with geotextile fabric, which is very puncture resistant and has a very high tensile strength. It allows the concrete to move, but it keeps the concrete from flying. The chain link catches the bigger material and the fabric catches the smaller material from flying up and out.}}</ref>
[[Coir]] (coconut fiber) geotextiles are popular for erosion control, slope stabilization and bioengineering, due to the fabric's substantial mechanical strength.<ref name="Dane Co" />{{rp|App. I.E}} Coir geotextiles last approximately 3 to 5 years depending on the fabric weight. The product degrades into [[humus]], enriching the soil.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://extension.oregonstate.edu/gardening/coir-sustainable-alternative-peat-moss-garden |title=Coir is sustainable alternative to peat moss in the garden |author=Richards, Davi |date=2006-06-02 |work=Garden Hints |publisher=Oregon State University Extension Service |location=Corvallis, OR |accessdate=2013-03-06}}</ref>
==Design methods== While many possible design methods or combinations of methods are available to the geotextile designer, the ultimate decision for a particular application usually takes one of three directions: design by cost and availability, design by specification, or design by function. Extensive literature on design methods for geotextiles has been published in the [[peer reviewed]] journal ''[[Geotextiles and Geomembranes]]''.
==See also== *[[Hard landscape materials]] *[[Sediment control]]

{{Infobox person |name =Guma Aguiar | image = Guma Aguiar.jpg | caption = |birth_name = Guma Leandro Aguiar |birth_date ={{Birth date|1977|5|31}} |birth_place = Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | disappeared_date = {{disappeared date and age|2012|6|19|1977|5|31}} | disappeared_place =[[Port Everglades]], Broward County, Florida, United States | disappeared_status = |death_date = [[Declared death in absentia|Declared legally dead]] January 29, 2015 |death_place = |residence = |nationality = | other_names = Guma Kaplan Aguiar{{cite web|last=Kamph |first=Stefan |url=http://blogs.browardpalmbeach.com/pulp/2012/09/guma_aguiar_israel_jerusalem_real_estate.php |title=Guma Aguiar's Apt.: Magic Mirror, Dolce & Gabbana Bathtub and More |publisher=Blogs.browardpalmbeach.com |date=2012-09-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/fla-judge-tosses-out-embezzlement-case-against-nbn-donor-1.278875 |title=Fla. judge tosses out embezzlement case against NbN donor |publisher=Haaretz.com |accessdate=2013-12-02}} |ethnicity = |alma_mater = |occupation = |spouse = {{marriage|Jamie Black|2005}} |children = 4 |parents = Otto de Souza Aguiar
Ellen Kaplan |known for = June 2012 disappearance | networth = }} '''Guma Leandro Aguiar''' (May 31, 1977 – disappeared June 19, 2012; [[Declared death in absentia|declared legally dead]] January 29, 2015{{Cite web|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead|last=Sun-Sentinel|first=South Florida|website=Sun-Sentinel.com|access-date=2016-05-24}}) was a Brazilian-born American energy [[industrialist]] and millionaire businessman who split his time between the United States and Israel. Aguiar was recognized as a philanthropist who supported a variety of Jewish causes including [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]] and the [[March of the Living]].ASHER ZEIGER and JTA, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/body-feared-to-be-that-of-guma-aguiar-found-on-florida-coast/ Body feared to be that of Guma Aguiar found on Florida coast], June 22, 2012, Retrieved December 4, 2013 In July 2009, Aguiar invested over $4 million (USD) in support of the [[Beitar Jerusalem F.C.|Beitar Jerusalem Football Club]]. On June 20, 2012, Aguiar was reported missing after his unoccupied boat was found on Fort Lauderdale Beach.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |title=Millionaire Guma Aguiar's ghost vessel comes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-07-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623194328/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |archivedate=2012-06-23 |df= }} The day before Aguiar went missing, a federal court judge ordered his mental health records be presented to the court as part of a lawsuit between him and his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]].{{cite web|last=Kamph |first=Stefan |url=http://blogs.browardpalmbeach.com/pulp/2012/06/guma_aguiars_mental_health_rec.php |title=Guma Aguiar's Mental Health Records Were Requested in Federal Court a Day Before He Vanished |publisher=Blogs.browardpalmbeach.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was declared legally dead in January 2015. ==Early life and education== Aguiar was born on May 31, 1977http://www.flpd.org/Home/ShowDocument?id=2568 in Rio de Janeiro. He was one of four children{{Cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2014-05-16/news/fl-guma-aguiar-estate-trial-openings-20140516_1_ellen-aguiar-guma-aguiar-jamie-aguiar|title=Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's mother, wife face off in Broward courtroom|access-date=2016-06-24}} of Ellen{{Cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/187806#.V22XnqKhNow|title='Vanished' Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Estate Divided among Heirs|website=Arutz Sheva|access-date=2016-06-24}} ({{née}} Kaplan), a Jewish mother,[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar Florida Sun Sentinel: "Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire Aguiar" By Linda Trischitta and Robert Nolin] June 30, 2012 and Otto de Souza Aguiar, a Christian father. His mother is the sister of billionaire investor [[Thomas Kaplan]], and his father was an artist and model.{{Cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/the-mystery-of-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-6389180|title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar|last=Kamph|first=Stefan|date=2012-09-20|access-date=2016-06-24}} Though Ellen is [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish, she considers herself a [[Born again (Christianity)|born-again]] Christian; Guma was raised as a Christian and the rest of the Aguiar family practiced Christianity as well. At age 26, Aguiar returned to Jewish observance after meeting rabbi [[Tovia Singer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thejc.com/lifestyle/lifestyle-features/20957/israels-abramovich-uses-football-unite-jerusalem|title=Israel's Abramovich uses football to unite Jerusalem | The Jewish Chronicle|date=2009-10-15|publisher=Thejc.com|accessdate=2012-07-09}} However, because he was born to an [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish mother, he did not need to formally convert. His family moved to [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] when Aguiar was one year old. He graduated from the [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy Christian School]] in 1995.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |title=Guma Aguiar video: Interview captures missing multimillionaire in happier moments |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-04-23 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095704/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} Aguiar enrolled at [[Clemson University]] in [[Clemson, South Carolina]] but dropped out after one year. ==Career== Aguiar was the vice chairman and [[chief executive officer]] of [[Leor Energy]]. Aguiar began his career as a clerk on the floor of the [[New York Mercantile Exchange|NYMEX]] in 1999 where he focused on the energy markets, with particular emphasis on [[natural gas]]. Transitioning from daily trading activity to the long-term physical markets, Aguiar joined with his uncle, [[Thomas Kaplan]], in 2001 to manage a portfolio of family investments ranging from [[venture capital]] to [[private equity]] and debt. During this time, he served as a director of several public and private companies and was given responsibility for creating a U.S.-based energy company focused on aggressive early-stage oil and gas exploration. After assembling a diversified portfolio of energy properties in Louisiana and Texas, ranging from unconventional natural gas to shallow oil, Aguiar identified and executed Leor's acquisition of its flagship property in the [[Deep Bossier]] of [[East Texas]] in 2003. In 2005, under Aguiar's executive management, Leor Energy engineered financings which fully capitalized the projects in Leor Energy LP. Included in these transactions were Leor Energy Lp industrial alliance with Encana, a natural gas producer in North America and the Leor Energy Lp joint-venture partner in the Deep Bossier. Under Aguiar, a [[Mezzanine capital|mezzanine financing]] with hedge-fund Amaranth Capital LLC{{Citation needed|date=October 2013}} was achieved.{{cite web|author= |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=4288364&privcapId=27143526&previousCapId=27143526&previousTitle=Leor%20Energy%20L.P |title=Guma Aguiar: Executive Profile & Biography - Businessweek |publisher=Investing.businessweek.com |date=2003-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Leor Energy has a financial alliance with its first strategic equity partner, [[Goldman Sachs|Goldman Sachs & Co]]. Aguiar joined Cadence Resources in July 2002 and served as a Member of the Board of Directors of Corporate Development until June 30, 2003. ==Philanthropic activities== Aguiar was the director of the Lillian Jean Kaplan Foundation and was involved in numerous philanthropic activities.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2009-01-25/news/0901240172_1_messiah-guma-aguiar-nephew|title=Multimillion-dollar family feud in court|work=tribunedigital-sunsentinel|accessdate=14 June 2015}} He donated more than US$8 million to fund the activities of [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]], a [[Zionist]] organization which promotes [[Aliyah]] (Jewish immigration) from North America and the United Kingdom to Israel. He was a supporter of the [[March of the Living]], which organizes educational programming in Poland and Israel to enable students to better understand the [[Holocaust]] and the rebirth of [[Zionism]] and the creation of the modern Jewish state of Israel. For his philanthropic activities, in April 2009, [[The Jewish Week]] recognized Aguiar as one of the "36 under 36″ (one of 36 of the most influential Jewish leaders under the age of 36).{{cite web|url=http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|title=36 Under 36 2009: Guma Aguiar, 33 - The Jewish Week|work=The Jewish Week|accessdate=14 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303172755/http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|archivedate=3 March 2016|df=}} In 2008, Aguiar founded the "Defender of Jerusalem Award" which recognizes public figures who have taken uniquely strong stances in support of Jerusalem.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/Perry-in-Israel-to-Receive--53135252.html|title=Perry in Israel to Receive Defender of Jerusalem Award|work=NBC 5 Dallas-Fort Worth|accessdate=14 June 2015}} In October 2009, Aguiar and his wife Jamie served as the co-chairs of the "Facing Tomorrow" Conference in Jerusalem organized by Israel's President [[Shimon Peres]]. During the conference, Aguiar was featured on a panel with the President and offered his vision of Israeli society and culture from the perspective of one of the country's most recognized entrepreneurs. ==Jerusalem sports== On July 21, 2009, Aguiar announced an investment of over US$4 million to support the [[Beitar Jerusalem]] [[Football team|Football Team]] which, despite a massive fan following, had grown into [[financial distress]] and was on the brink of collapse prior to Aguiar's financial contributions. Aguiar was motivated to purchase the team out of his love for the sport combined with a passion for Jerusalem and Israel. In September 2009, Aguiar took his commitment to Jerusalem sports to the next level when he invested over $1.5 million in the city's leading basketball franchise, [[Hapoel Jerusalem B.C.|Hapoel Jerusalem]]. Since these investments, Aguiar became a fixture in Israeli social circles and regularly met with members of Knesset and local political and business leaders. Aguiar managed the teams and was in contact with the general managers of both Betar ([[Itzik Kornfein]]) and Hapoel (Dani Klein). In November 2009, Aguiar travelled with Kornfein to Brazil with the goal of scouting out players for the Betar team. He made an effort to be at team practices and met with the players and staff of both teams. Beitar fans attribute Beitar's winning the [[Toto Cup]] on 26 January 2010 to Aguiar's financial backing, although it was won while Aguiar was hospitalized in a psychiatric facility. About a half an hour after winning, Itzik Kornfein{{cite web |url=http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |title=קורנפיין נסע עם גביע הטוטו לאגיאר |publisher=Sport5.co.il |date=2010-01-26 |accessdate=2012-09-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130108072905/http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |archivedate=2013-01-08 |df= }} took the Toto Cup to the psychiatric hospital but was not permitted to enter. He asked the security staff to take in the trophy to the hospitalized Aguiar. ==Personal life== In 2005, Aguiar married his [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy]] high school sweetheart, Jamie Elizabeth Black. Jamie graduated from the [[University of Florida]] with a degree in Public Relations.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} They had four children, Jacob, Lilly, Jonathan, and Leo{{cite web|url=http://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/new-york/nysdce/1:2011mc00290/383539/3/3.html|title=Document 3 :: Ellen Aguiar v. William Natbony, et al :: 1:2011mc00290 :: New York Southern District Court :: US Federal District Courts Cases :: Justia|date=|publisher=Law.justia.com|accessdate=2013-12-02}} and celebrated both Christmas and Hanukkah.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2253254/Wife-missing-millionaire-Guma-Aguiar-speaks-grief-holiday-season.html The Daily Mail: "Wife of millionaire who mysteriously vanished on night-time boat ride tells of her heartache as she spends first Christmas alone with their children"] December 25, 2012 The process of immigration to Israel was an act described by himself as a personal dream.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} Prior to his disappearance, Aguiar divided his time between the [[Yemin Moshe]] quarter in [[Jerusalem]] and South Florida. Aguiar was friends with [[Alan Dershowitz]].{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/08/27/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar.html |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Thedailybeast.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was a [[Zionism|Zionist]]. ==Criminal history== Aguiar pleaded no contest to drug charges in 2009 after police found marijuana in his car during a traffic stop in Florida.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57460337/ |title=Missing oil tycoon Guma Aguiar was spiraling out of control before vanishing at sea, friends say |publisher=CBS News |date=2012-06-26 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar/2 |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Page 2 - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|author=Stefan Kamph |url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/2012-09-20/news/fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-s-disappearance-at-sea-is-a-mystery/5/ |title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar - Page 5 - News - Miami |publisher=Miami New Times |date=2012-09-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/39972/2009/10/18/fort-lauderdale-fl-multimillionaire-who-accused-broward-deputies-of-anti-semitism-takes-plea-deal/ |title=Fort Lauderdale, FL - Multimillionaire Who Accused Broward Deputies of Anti-Semitism Takes Plea Deal |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar publicly stated that the police were out to get him and that "When I got to the prison [an officer] took my kippah off and then tried to convert me to Christianity."{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/alan-dershowitz-enlisted-by-guma-aguiar-to-take-on-fla-law-1.5540 |title=Alan Dershowitz enlisted by Guma Aguiar to take on Fla. law |publisher=Haaretz.com |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar hired [[Alan Dershowitz]] to represent him.{{cite web |url=http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Israeli billionaire in psychiatric hospital |publisher=Israelity |date=2010-01-14 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102075629/http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |archivedate=2013-11-02 |df= }} Aguiar's wife Jamie filed a domestic violence protective order against him in the summer of 2011. He then filed for divorce, but both the domestic violence allegations and the divorce filing were stopped. ==Mental health== Aguiar's mother has said that Aguiar experienced his first [[Psychosis|psychotic]] episode at age 19 and that he was diagnosed with severe [[Bipolar I disorder|bipolar]] disorder and psychosis.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-billionaire-uncle-thomas-kaplan/story?id=16703264 |title=Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Billionaire Uncle Thomas Kaplan Is Suspicious - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-07-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was admitted to psychiatric hospitals several times.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |title=Guma Aguiar missing: Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire |publisher=Wptv.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095720/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} On January 14, 2010, Aguiar was [[Involuntary commitment|involuntarily committed]] to a mental hospital in Israel by his mother.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/rabbis-facilitate-truce-missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-mom/story?id=16671744&page=2 |title=Page 2: Rabbis Facilitate Truce Between Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Mom and Wife - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|last=Tracy |first=Marc |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/news-and-politics/23723/prodigal-son/ |title=Prodigal Son - by Allison Hoffman - Tablet Magazine – Jewish News and Politics, Jewish Arts and Culture, Jewish Life and Religion |publisher=Tabletmag.com |date=2010-01-15 |accessdate=2012-07-09}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/nathanvardi/2012/06/28/the-tragedy-of-guma-aguiar-and-a-2-billion-texas-gas-fortune/ |title=The Tragedy Of Guma Aguiar And A $2 Billion Texas Gas Fortune |publisher=Forbes |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Betar-sponsor-in-psychiatric-hospital |title=Betar sponsor in psychiatric hospital | JPost | Israel News |publisher=JPost |date=2010-01-17 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/46976/2010/01/14/jerusalem-court-orders-guma-aguiar-to-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Jerusalem - Court Orders Guma Aguiar To Psychiatric Hospital |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In 2011, due to his mental illness, his wife Jamie and mother Ellen petitioned a [[Miami-Dade County, Florida|Miami-Dade]] judge for guardianship over Aguiar. The court agreed, and appointed an emergency guardianship over Aguiar.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/troubled-florida-millionaire-guma-aguiar-missing-empty-yacht/story?id=16619645&page=2 |title=Page 2: Troubled Florida Millionaire Guma Aguiar Missing After Empty Yacht Washes Ashore - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Two days after his disappearance in June 2012, Aguiar's mother filed documents in Broward County, Florida court to become [[Conservatorship|conservator]] of his nearly $100 million fortune. In Ellen Aguiar's petition, she wrote that Guma "disappeared as the result of mental derangement or other mental cause" or disappeared "under circumstances indicating that he may have died, either naturally, or accidentally." It further stated that he suffered from "severe bipolar disorder."{{cite web|author= |url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-22/news/fl-guma-aguiar-missing-folo-20120621_1_fishing-boat-search-ends-petition |title=Missing millionaire Guma Aguiar - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was sued by his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]]. As part of that lawsuit, the judge presiding over the case, John O'Sullivan, found that Aguiar's psychosis "manifested itself in both grandiose and paranoid delusions," for example, Aguiar's belief that he (Aguiar) was being followed by snipers. On the day Aguiar disappeared, a federal judge in Florida issued an order appointing an independent medical examiner to see if Aguiar was psychologically sound enough for a deposition in the case. ==Disappearance== On June 20, 2012, Aguiar's 31-foot, center console Jupiter boat, named the ''T.T. Zion'',{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-20/news/fl-missing-fort-lauderdale-boater-20120620_1_detective-travis-mandell-fishing-boat-captain |title=Millionaire missing after boat washes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | first2 = Jon | last2 = Burstein | work = Sun Sentinel |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |title=Guma Aguiar missing: As the search ends for missing millionaire, mother seeks to protect his assets |publisher=WPTV.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120624235845/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |archivedate=2012-06-24 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2012/06/21/Yacht-tender-washes-ashore-without-owner/UPI-20981340307068/ |title=Yacht tender washes ashore without owner Guma Aguiar |publisher=UPI.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} landed on Fort Lauderdale Beach east of East Las Olas Boulevard around 1:15 a.m., with its navigation lights on and engines still running, according to the ''[[Sun-Sentinel]]''. [[Sea Tow]], the company that Fort Lauderdale authorities contracted to tow the boat, said that the vessel appeared seaworthy and did not believe a mechanical problem had occurred. Aguiar's wallet and cell phone were found on board, but no sign of him or any other passenger was found. Authorities on [[All-terrain vehicle|ATVs]] searched up and down the beach, but found no sign of Aguiar. The [[United States Coast Guard|Coast Guard]] commenced a search at sea. A search of his house found that his watch and wedding band had been left behind.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2197830/Guma-Aguiar-Missing-millionaire-left-wedding-ring-watch-night-disappeared.html |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing millionaire left his wedding ring and watch behind on night he disappeared... but he bought [sic] along a special Jewish text for 'solace' | first = Beth | last = Stebner | first2 = Meghan | last2 = Keneally |publisher=DailyMail.co.uk |date=2012-09-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In July 2012 and June 2013, the Ft. Lauderdale Police Department said that even though the investigation remains open, there have been no significant leads in the case.{{cite web|url=http://www.shmais.com/chabad-news/latest/item/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Shmais.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite news | url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/19/guma-aguiar-update-2013_n_3463073.html | title = Guma Aguiar: Fate of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Still A Mystery One Year Later | work = Sun Sentinel | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | date = August 18, 2013 | location = Fort Lauderdale, Florida}} Aguiar was declared legally dead on January 29, 2015, two years and seven months after his disappearance.{{Cite news |url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead| first = Linda | last = Trischitta | work=Sun-Sentinel| date = January 29, 2015 | access-date=2016-05-24}} ==See also== {{portal|Biography|Brazil|Florida|Israel}} *[[List of people who disappeared mysteriously]] {{clear}} revision.comment: as a manmade mining shaft, would not normally be considered a cave
revision.text:
A ''gypsum cave'' is a natural [[karst]]ic formation in [[gypsum]].<ref name="researchgate ukraine">Alexander Klimchouk, [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/220044221_Ukraine_gypsum_caves_and_karst Ukraine gypsum caves and karst], ''Researchgate.net'', January 2012</ref>
Gypsum caves can be found in several places on earth, including: *The Optymistychna cave in Ukraine, considered the longest gypsum cave at 232 km<ref name="researchgate ukraine"/> *[[Orda Cave]] underneath the Western [[Ural Mountains]], with 5.1km length, including 4.8km underwater<ref>Floro Mercene, [https://www.pressreader.com/philippines/tempo/20170612/281663959988109 The world's greatest underwater gypsum cave], ''Pressreader.com'', 12 June 2017</ref> *[[Cuevas de Sorbas]] in [[Almeria]], [[Spain]]
==References== <references/>
==Related pages== *[[Gypsum]] *[[Karst]]
==External links== *[http://www.caverbob.com/gypcave.htm World's longest gypsum caves compiled]

[[File:Siegel Elbing 1350.jpg|thumb|Seal of Elbing (1350)]] '''Hanseatic flags''' are the [[banner]]s of [[Hanseatic cities]], that were flown by [[cog (ship)|cogs]] and other ships of the [[Hanseatic league]] - as illustrated on the 1350 seal of Elbing shown here.
==History== Originally, Hanseatic ships displayed red [[gonfalone]]s on their masts, which had a cross at its peak to denote the protection of the sovereign. Red was also the colour used by [[Denmark|Danish]] and [[Kingdom of England|English]] shipping, the English later adopting the [[St George's Cross]]. From the second half of the 13th century, the individual Hanseatic cities created various banners to distinguish themselves from other member cities. The red gonfalone remained in use in addition to these flags. The oldest Hanseatic flag is the plain red banner used by [[Hamburg]]. Hanseatic flags were mostly red-white and some featured symbols, such as crosses.
Many cities that were members of the Hanseatic league continue to use red and white as their city colours today.
== Hanseatic pennant == In addition to these banners, ships also flew a Hanseatic pennant (''Hanseatenwimpel'') where the upper half is white (silver) and the lower half is red.
[[File:Hanseatenwimpel.svg|thumb|center|700px|Hanseatic pennant (1:16)]] {{clear}}
== Banners ==
=== 13th century === <gallery> File:Hanse_Hamburg.svg|[[Hamburg]] File:Hanse_Riga.svg|[[Riga]] File:Hanse_Lübeck.svg|[[Free City of Lübeck|Lübeck]] </gallery>
=== 14th century === <gallery> File:Hanse_Bremen.svg|[[Bremen]] File:Hanse_Danzig.svg|Danzig ([[Gdańsk]]) File:Hanse_Elbing.svg|Elbing ([[Elbląg]]) File:Hanse_Rostock.svg|[[Rostock]] File:Hanse_Stralsund.svg|[[Stralsund]] </gallery>
=== 15th century === <gallery> File:Hanse_Königsberg.svg|Königsberg ([[Kaliningrad]]) File:Hanse_Wismar.svg|[[Wismar]] File:Hanse_Stettin.svg|Stettin ([[Szczecin]]) </gallery>
=== Other seals and coins === <gallery> File:Siegel Stralsund 1329.preview.png|Seal of Stralsund (1329) </gallery>
==Flags of Hanseatic cities today==
<gallery> File:Flag of Bremen.svg|[[Bremen]] File:POL Elbląg flag.svg|[[Elbing]] (Elbląg) File:Gdansk flag.svg|[[Danzig]] File:Flag of Hamburg.svg|[[Hamburg]] File:Flag of Kampen.svg|[[Kampen, Overijssel | Kampen]] File:Kaliningrad flag.PNG|[[Kaliningrad|Königsberg]] File:Flagge der Hansestadt Lübeck.svg|[[Lübeck]] File:Flag of et-Parnu.svg|[[Pernau]] (Pärnu) File:Flagge Rostock.svg|[[Rostock]] File:Flag of Stralsund.svg|[[Stralsund]] File:POL Szczecin flag.svg|[[Stettin]] (Szczecin) File:Flag of Tallinn.svg|[[Tallinn|Reval (Tallinn)]] File:Tartu flag.svg|[[Tartu|Dorpat (Tartu)]] File:Flag of Wismar.svg|[[Wismar]] File:Flag of et-Viljandi.svg|[[Viljandi|Fellin (Viljandi)]] </gallery>
==External links== * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/de_hansa.html FOTW: Hanseatic League and Cities (Germany, Latvia, Netherlands, Poland, Belgium)] * [http://www.ngw.nl/ International Civic Heraldry]

revision.text:
{{main|ISO 3166-2}}
'''ISO 3166-2:GI''' is the entry for [[Gibraltar]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]].
Currently no ISO 3166-2 codes are defined in the entry for Gibraltar. The territory has no defined subdivisions.
Gibraltar is officially assigned the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code {{mono|GI}}.
==External links== * [https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:GI ISO Online Browsing Platform: GI] * [http://www.statoids.com/ugi.html Gibraltar], Statoids.com
{{ISO 3166}}
[[Category:ISO 3166|2:GI]] [[Category:Geography of Gibraltar]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = John Henry Cox | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = ''[[circa]]'' 1750 | birth_place = [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] | death_date = {{death date and given age|1791|10|05|df=y|41}} | death_place = [[Huangpu District, Guangzhou|Whampoa, Canton, China]] | education = | occupation = [[Explorer]] | spouse = | parents = | children = | nationality = [[English people|English]] }} '''John Henry Cox''' (c. 1750{{spaced endash}}5 October 1791) was an [[English people|English]] [[explorer]] who charted [[Great Oyster Bay]], [[Maria Island]], and [[Marion Bay, Tasmania|Marion Bay]] on the east coast of [[Tasmania]] in 1789, aboard his armed [[brig]] [[Her Majesty's Ship|HMS]] ''[[HMS Mercury|Mercury]]''.<ref name="West 1852, p10">{{harv|West|1852|p=10}}</ref>
== Early years == John Henry Cox was born c. 1750, the son of a rich jewellery merchant in London. His father [[James Cox (inventor)|James]] had a factory in Shoe Lane, which specialised in the manufacture of clocks and automatons (known as "sing-songs" in [[Chinese Pidgin English|pidgin English]]), designed as bribes for Chinese [[Mandarin (bureaucrat)|mandarins]] who were in control of the [[Thirteen Factories|native merchants]] with whom Europeans were obliged to deal in trade negotiations in [[Guangzhou|Canton]]. He even published a work on his activity.<ref>J. Cox, A Descriptive Inventory of Several Exquisite and Magnificent Pieces of Mechanism and Jewellery. (London 1773).</ref> When his father died towards the end of the 1770s, Cox turned to the [[East India Company]] for permission to stay in China for three years to sell the residue of his father's stock of clocks, and ostensibly "for his health's sake". In May 1780 he was given permission to stay for two years and February 1781 saw him installed at Canton as a merchant, but privately and not under the control of the company.<ref>H.B. Morse, The Chronicle of the East India Company trading to China 1635–1834, vol. II., (Oxford, 1926), 85.</ref>
When the two years had passed, he applied for a year's extension, which was granted because of his "good bearing" and because he had been of special help to certain company chiefs. Cox then found it advantageous to move to [[Macao]], where he was in association with a Scot, [[John Reid (merchant)|John Reid]] – who from 1779 had been [[Austrian consul]] and a naturalised Austrian subject – together with another Scotsman, [[Prussia]]n consul [[Daniel Beale]]. All of their subterfuges{{elucidate|date=April 2018}} were aimed at bypassing the East India Company's restrictive regulations.
In 1784 Cox branched out and sent a ship up to the [[Pacific Northwest|northwest coast of America]] with a cargo of iron, knives, nails etc. which he could use as barter for furs and skins. He operated on the West coast of [[Vancouver Island]], especially [[Nootka Sound]]. Business went so well, that Cox and his associates founded the [[Bengal Fur Society]] in [[Calcutta]] and continued their activity into the following years. This led to [[Lord Cornwallis]], [[Governor-General of India|Bengal's general governor]], in 1787 complaining to the East India Company about their conduct, all to no avail. By this time, the [[United States|Americans]] had joined in the fray; evidence of their activity remains in the "Columbia" and ''Washington'' medals, which [[Boston]] merchants struck to celebrate the sailing in September 1787 of these two US vessels for the northwest coast of America. The [[British Admiralty]] had in 1772 issued similar medals (struck by [[Matthew Boulton]]) featuring ''Resolution'' and ''Adventure'' celebrating [[James Cook]]'s second voyage.
== ''Mercury''==
===Swedish endorsement===
Cox, at this stage, having already considerably overstayed his welcome, thought it wise to disappear to England for a spell but was soon back with newly hatched plans. This time, his idea was to see whether he could exploit the [[Russo-Swedish War (1788–1790)|Russo-Swedish War of 1788–90]]. He paid a visit first to [[Gothenburg]], where he made good use of the services of the [[Swedish East India Company]]'s representatives there, [[William Chalmers (merchant)|William Chalmers]], [[Lars Gotheen]] and [[J.A. Sandberg]]. Through these men he was able to make contact with [[Baron Erik Ruuth]] who was Gustav III's [[King of Sweden|Swedish king]] Secretary of State for Commerce and Finance.
The king was apparently very enthusiastic about Cox's quite fantastic proposal which was in effect to put his brig ''Mercury'', newly purchased from the renowned [[Marmaduke Stalkartt]], [[Deptford]], at the disposal of Sweden and with her act as a privateer to raid both the eastern Russian coasts and their North American fur and skin establishments, for which Sweden would earn ten percent of the prizes.<ref>{{harv|Williamson|1975|p=28}}, copper-bottomed, 16-gun brig ''Mercury'' launched 15 December 1788 by the renowned Marmaduke Stalkartt, Deptford, 82' x 22'6", 152 tons. Builder's Certificate dated 22 December 1788.</ref> The last page of the king's instructions is signed Gustaf by the king at Ghiöteborg (Gothenburg) 11 November 1788 and refers to his authorisation to Captain John Henry Cox of the Swedish naval brig ''Gustaf den Tredie'', (''Gustaf III''), ''Mercury'''s cover-name.<ref>The [[Swedish National Archives]] Reference No to King Gustav III's instructions to John Henry Cox is: Ruuthska handlingarna (1 volym) SE/RA/721404.Georg Hafström, ”John Henry Cox som svensk sjöofficer”, ''Forum navale'' (Stockholm), 14, 1957, s.6–29.</ref>
===England to Tasmania===
[[River Thames|The Thames]] was still suffering under extreme weather conditions that winter, with the river frozen, and ''Mercury'' was not able to leave [[Gravesend, Kent|Gravesend]] on her prospective long voyage before 26 February 1789, but under English colours, as her destination was to be kept secret. Cox had provided himself with a chronometer made by William Hughes of [[Holborn]] and had it set to GMT in the mathematical school in [[Christ's Hospital]], the headmaster of which was [[William Wales (astronomer)|William Wales]], who had sailed as astronomer in Captain Cook's second voyage from 1772–5.<ref>{{harv|Williamson|1975|p=19}}</ref> Cox had originally intended taking the route via [[Cape Horn]], but on account of the late departure decided to change this plan and take the route via the [[Cape of Good Hope]].
Lieut. [[George Mortimer]] of the Marines wrote an account of the voyage.<ref>{{harv|Mortimer|1791}}</ref><ref>Rolf E. Du Rietz, "A secret Anglo-Swedish naval expedition to the Pacific in 1789", ''Banksia'' (Uppsala), no. 5, 2002.</ref> Unfortunately he records almost no details of the ship's crew but does mention the death of the [[Chief Cook|ship's cook]] Thomas Smith on 8 October 1789. He also mentions that Cox had invited a number of his friends, making it sound almost like a rich man's yacht cruise. On 25 March they sailed from [[Tenerife]], crossed the Line in 20 degrees West and on 28 April they were passing [[Tristan da Cunha]]. Just about then, Captain [[William Bligh]] of HMS ''[[HMS Bounty|Bounty]]'' and the loyal members of the crew were being forced into the long boat by the mutineers led by [[Fletcher Christian]]. On 29 May ''Mercury'' reached their first objective, [[Île Amsterdam|Amsterdam Island]] in the [[Roaring Forties]], half way between Africa and Australia, discovered in 1522 by [[del Cano]] during his circumnavigation. Here they procured 1,000 [[Seal hunting|seal skins]] and several barrels of oil. Mortimer believed that ''Mercury'' was probably the first English vessel to visit the island. He refers to [[Alexander Dalrymple]]'s ''Account of the Discoveries Made in the S. Pacific Ocean'', (London, 1767), which deals with the island, and states that the account by the Dutchman [[Willem de Vlamingh]], first to land on the island, in 1696, though short, was tolerably accurate.<ref>{{harv|Mortimer|1791|p=10}}</ref> On 8 July ''Mercury'' was anchoring in a bay on the east coast of [[Van Diemen's Land]], now Tasmania, for wood and water, and Cox named it [[Great Oyster Bay|Oyster Bay]], a name that still holds.<ref>{{harv|Williamson|1975|p=20}}</ref> He also charted Maria Island and Marion Bay there.<ref name="West 1852, p10" />
===Crossing the Pacific===
They reached [[Tahiti]] on 13 August and anchored in [[Matavai Bay]], where ''Bounty'' had lain for many months. Although some of the mutineers had remained, it was assumed that they lay hidden while ''Mercury'' was there. Mortimer communicated the intelligence to the Admiralty in respect of the probable destination of the Bounty mutineers, "as it is hoped will enable Captain Edwards of the [[HMS Pandora (1779)|''Pandora'']] frigate to bring them to that condign punishment they so justly merit".<ref>{{harv|Mortimer|1791|p=vii}}</ref> Captain Edwards' name appears on the list of subscribers to Mortimer's book.
''Mercury'' stayed at Hawaii for only about two days between 23 and 25 September. On 27 October they were anchored in an inlet on [[Unalaska Island]], one of the [[Fox Islands Group]]. They had come a month or two too late, and found that the natives had no furs to trade, but they did stay for about two weeks, which seemed long enough for the United States to name one of the Alaskan rivers [[Coxe]], using the spelling of his name that he used when referring to his Swedish assignment. It seems in fact that Cox only took the brig there as a gesture of fulfilling the contract with the Swedish king. Apparently he had considered returning at a more suitable time, but the Russian-Swedish [[Treaty of Värälä]] signed on 14 August 1790 precluded any such plans. If Cox had gone prowling further afield round the North Pacific he might have found unexpected and surprising opposition; the Empress [[Catherine II of Russia|Catherine II]] had commissioned an expedition to carry out exploration work in the far east of [[Siberia]] and the [[Bering Sea]]. In charge of the Expedition was an Englishman in the [[Imperial Russian Navy|Russian Naval Service]], Commodore [[Joseph Billings]],<ref>M. Sauer, ''An Account of a Geographical and Astronomical Expedition to the Northern parts of Russia'', (London, 1802).</ref> who was alerted regarding Cox's presence, but far too late, for by that time Cox was back in Macao, where he anchored on 27 December 1789, careful to advertise the appearance of the Swedish armed brig "Gustavus III" commanded by Captain John Henry Cox of the Swedish Royal Navy.<ref>{{harv|Williamson|1975|p=29}}</ref> He lost no time in writing a report to the Directors of the Swedish East India Co on 4 January 1790.<ref>Godegårdsarkivet I Nordiska Museet, J.A. Grills handlingar, Korrespondens, vol. 13.</ref>
===Northern Pacific===
Port Cox (since renamed [[Clayoquot Sound]]<ref>[http://archive.ilmb.gov.bc.ca/bcgn-bin/bcg10?name=1975 BCGNIS entry "Clayoquot Sound"]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>), a bay southeast of [[Nootka Sound]] on the west coast of [[Vancouver Island]], and [[Cox's Channel]], a sound in the northernmost tip of the [[Queen Charlotte Islands]] between [[Langara Island]] and the northwestern tip of [[Graham Island]]<ref>[http://archive.ilmb.gov.bc.ca/bcgn-bin/bcg10?name=48770 BCGNIS entry "Cox's Channel"]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> and now named [[Parry Passage]]<ref>[http://archive.ilmb.gov.bc.ca/bcgn-bin/bcg10?name=36940 BCGNIS entry "Parry Passage"]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> are named after Cox.<ref>J. Meares, ''Voyages made in the years 1788 and 1789 from China to the North West Coast of America'', (London, 1790), 143, 365.</ref> According to the record in the [[Geographic Names Information System]] (GNIS), the nation's official geographic names repository of the US Board of Geographic Names, the mouth of the [[Coxe River]], (note spelling) where it empties into [[Katlian Bay]] is at {{coord|57|10|24|N|135|16|37|W|display=inline}}. The source, or where the stream begins, is at {{coord|57|11|41|N|135|11|58|W|display=inline}}.<ref>Internet communication 4 May 2009 from Roger Payne, [[US Board on Geographic Names]].</ref>
Cox appears to have intended to use the Swedish contract more as a talisman with which to confound the [[East India Company]] rather than wreak any damage on the Russians. Some evidence of this lies in the fact Mortimer's account has no mention of any gun drill, something that ought to have been a necessary part of the operation; only once does Mortimer mention even airing their powder.
Excessive speculation drove Reid into bankruptcy. He therefore closed the [[List of diplomatic missions of Austria|Austrian Consulate]] and left China. Cox's partnership however with Daniel Beale and his younger brother [[Thomas Beale|Thomas]] continued, at any rate under the combined name, during Cox's long period away from Canton. There were further successful voyages to northwest America, always under the Portuguese flag. However, in later years, competition from Spanish ships began to have effect. After his return to Canton, Cox was quickly in business again in Macao.
It was at the end of September 1791 that Cox sailed ''Mercury'' up the river to Canton's outer port [[Huangpu District, Guangzhou|Whampoa]]. The Honourable East India Company did not welcome him; on the contrary it threatened Cox in every way, refusing to allow him right of residence because it was considered that he, English citizen that he was, had broken the company's "sacred" monopoly. Nonetheless, Cox raised a [[Flag of Prussia|Prussian flag]] and landed exuding disrespectful protests.
== Death == Cox did not live long enough to really enjoy the fortune he had amassed and died aged 41 years, on 5 October 1791 and was buried the following day on French Island that lay within sight of the ships moored at Whampoa, and was where all foreigners who died at Canton, or aboard the ships, were interred at the end of the 18th century.<ref>{{harv|Williamson|1975|p=23}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}}
==Bibliography== * Robert J. King, "Heinrich Zimmermann and the Proposed Voyage of the KKS Cobenzell to the North West Coast in 1782–1783", ''The Northern Mariner/Le Marin du Nord,'' vol.21, no.3, July 2011, pp. 235–262. * Robert J. King, "John Meares: Dubliner, Naval Officer, Fur Trader and would-be Colonizer", ''Journal of Australian Naval History,'' vol.8, no.1, March 2011, pp. 32–62. * {{cite book|first=Lieut. George|last=Mortimer|title=Observations & Remarks Made During a Voyage to the North West Coast of America|location=London|year= 1791|ref={{harvid|Mortimer|1791}}}} * {{cite book|title=The history of Tasmania|first=John|last= West|authorlink=John West (writer)|location = Launceston, Tasmania|publisher= H. Dowling|year= 1852|oclc=18133771|ref={{harvid|West|1852}}}} * {{citation|title = Eastern traders: some men and ships of Jardine, Matheson & Company and their {{sic|contemporaires}} in the East India Company's Maritime service ; a collection of articles|first = A. Robert|last= Williamson|publisher = Jardine, Matheson & Co.|year= 1975|ref={{harvid|Williamson|1975}}}}
{{Authority control}} {{East Coast Tasmania}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cox, John Henry}} [[Category:1750 births]] [[Category:1791 deaths]] [[Category:18th-century explorers]] [[Category:History of Tasmania]] [[Category:People from London]] [[Category:English cartographers]] [[Category:18th-century cartographers]] [[Category:18th-century merchants]]

{{Other places|Lake Rotoroa (disambiguation){{!}}Lake Rotoroa}}
{{Infobox body of water | name = Lake Rotoroa | image = Lake Rotoroa Hamilton Lake (175002898).jpg | caption = | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Hamilton, New Zealand|Hamilton]], [[Waikato]], [[North Island]] | coords = {{coord|37.799|S|175.274|E|region:NZ_type:waterbody|display=inline,title}} | type = [[eutrophic]] | inflow = | outflow = Waitawhiriwhiri Stream | catchment = {{convert|258|ha|abbr=on}}<ref>[https://www.waikatoregion.govt.nz/assets/PageFiles/37521/TR201459.pdf Waikato Regional Council Technical Report 2014/59 Waikato region shallow lakes management plan: Volume 2]</ref> | basin_countries = [[New Zealand]] | length = | width = | area = {{convert|54|ha|abbr=on}} | depth = {{convert|2.4|m|abbr=on}} | max-depth = {{convert|6|m|abbr=on}} | volume = {{convert|1.3|km3|acre.ft|abbr=on}} | residence_time = approx. 2 years | shore = | elevation = {{convert|37.15|m}} | islands = | cities = }}
'''Lake Rotoroa''' (or '''Hamilton Lake Domain''') is a [[lake]] in [[Hamilton, New Zealand|Hamilton]], [[Waikato]], [[North Island]], [[New Zealand]]. It has a surface area of about 54 hectares<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.govt.nz/enviroinfo/water/lakes/shallowlakes/peatlakes/rotoroa.htm |title= EW Lake Rotoroa |accessdate=2007-12-02 |work= |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071019001829/http://www.ew.govt.nz/enviroinfo/water/lakes/shallowlakes/peatlakes/rotoroa.htm |archivedate = 2007-10-19}}</ref> and an average depth of 2.4 metres.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lernz.co.nz/lake_information/waikato/lake_rotoroa.shtml |title=Lake Rotoroa |accessdate=2007-12-02 |work= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070704052517/http://www.lernz.co.nz/lake_information/waikato/lake_rotoroa.shtml |archivedate=2007-07-04 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> It is the home of the Hamilton Yacht Club, which holds regular sailing in the summer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hyc.org.nz |title=Hamilton Yacht Club |accessdate=2007-12-02 |format= |work= }}</ref>
Lake Rotoroa formed, like most of the Waikato lakes, about 20,000 years ago, when the [[Waikato River#Origin|Waikato]] changed to flow out at [[Port Waikato]], rather than at [[Thames, New Zealand|Thames]]. It was a [[braided river]], but most of its braided courses were left as lakes once the river cut its present lower level. [[Peat]] then dammed and increased the size of the lakes.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://researchcommons.waikato.ac.nz/bitstream/handle/10289/5316/3.%20Ham%20basin%20soils%20Lowe%20%202010.pdf?sequence=1|title=Introduction to the landscapes and soils of the Hamilton Basin|last=Lowe|first=D. J.|date=2010|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
Innes Common, to the west, is {{Convert|68|acre||abbr=on}} of former wetland, bought by the Domain Board to protect the lake<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/AS19291002.2.83|title=Airport for Hamilton.|date=1929-10-02|work=Auckland Star|access-date=2017-09-28|pages=7}}</ref> and drained some time after 1883.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/WT18831110.2.9|title=Hamilton Domain Board.|date=1883-11-10|work=Waikato Times|access-date=2017-09-28|pages=2}}</ref> It was named after the Innes family from 1956.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://hamiltonheritagecollections.co.nz/nodes/view/488|title=Opening of Innes Common|website=Hamilton|access-date=2017-09-28}}</ref>
Near the cafe, a shelter covers the old locomotive, [[NZR F class#Preserved locomotives|F230]], donated in 1957.
On Ruakiwi Rd an ivy-covered memorial arch <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressreader.com/new-zealand/waikato-times/20111114/282029029025988|title=PressReader.com - Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com|access-date=2017-09-28}}</ref> to Arthur Swarbrick, former chairman of the Hamilton Domain Board, dates from 1929.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/NZH19290508.2.12.6|title=To the Memory of a Well – Known Waikato Resident. (the Gateway Erected at the Entrance to the Hamilton Lake in Memory of the Late Mr. Arthur Swarbrick, for Many Years Chairman of the Hamilton Domain Board.|date=1929-05-08|work=New Zealand Herald|access-date=2017-09-28|pages=8}}</ref>
The lake is sometimes affected by [[cyanobacteria]], due to its high nutrient levels.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hamilton.govt.nz/our-city/parks/parksandgardens/Pages/Hamilton-Lake-Domain.aspx|title=Hamilton Lake Domain - Hamilton City Council|website=www.hamilton.govt.nz|language=en-NZ|access-date=2017-09-28}}</ref> However, the [[Trophic state index|eutrophic]] quality of the lake has improved since 1998 due to regrowth of [[Macrophyte|macrophytes]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.waikatoregion.govt.nz/Environment/Natural-resources/Water/Lakes/Shallow-lakes-of-the-Waikato-region/Peat-lakes/Lake-Rotoroa/|title=Lake Rotoroa|website=Waikato Regional Council|language=en-NZ|access-date=2017-09-28}}</ref> such as [[Charophyta|charophytes]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/environment/75575279/lake-rotoroa-an-ancient-lake-makes-a-comeback|title=Lake Rotoroa: an ancient lake makes a comeback|website=Stuff|access-date=2017-09-28}}</ref>
In 1959 11,000 litres of [[sodium arsenate]] was poured in the lake to control weeds. [[Arsenic]] is still in the sediment and eating fish from the lake is not recommended;<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hamilton.govt.nz/our-city/parks/parksandgardens/Documents/Hamilton_Lake_Domain_Management_Plan.pdf|title=Hamilton Lake Domain Management Plan|last=|first=|date=2017|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> it's on Regional Council's contaminated sites list. Copper, lead, mercury and zinc also exceed the [[Environmental protection#Australia|Australian and New Zealand Environment and Conservation Council]] (ANZECC) guideline value in parts of the lake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.waikatoregion.govt.nz/assets/PageFiles/19699/TR201118.pdf|title=Significance of Arsenic in Sediments of Lake Rotoroa (Hamilton Lake)|last=Rumsby|first=Andrew|date=March 2008|website=Environment Waikato|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> [[File:Lake_House,_Hamilton,_New_Zealand.jpg|alt=|thumb|Lake House viewed from the boardwalk. It was designed by [[Isaac Richardson Vialou]] in 1872 for [[Alfred Cox (politician)|Alfred Cox]] as the homestead of the [[Rukuhia railway station|Rukuhia]] Estate, which originally covered 6,000 hectares. Vialou became first [[Mayor of Hamilton, New Zealand|mayor of Hamilton]] in 1878.]]
== Sports == Lake Rotoroa is a venue for many sports.
At Innes Common, a park on the east side of the lake is the [http://www.sportsground.co.nz/ClubSite.asp?SiteID=7646&PageTypeID=1&PageID=25476 Waikato Hockey Association Sports Ground].
Innes Common also provides the best access to the lake for watersports. Small sailing boats and canoes are frequently seen on the lake. The lake is too small for rowing skiffs because as soon as they get up to top speed they have to stop. The lake is better suited to slower boats that can turn easily.
The 3.8 km scenic path around the lake makes it a suitable venue for walking and running. The [https://hamiltonroadrunners.org.nz Hamilton Road Runners Club] is based at the Hamilton Yacht Club and meets there for runs every Thursday evening and Saturday morning, as well as hosting a running event at the lake each year in summer.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.runningcalendar.co.nz/series/hamilton-summer-series/|title=Fun Run Summer Series in Hamilton, New Zealand|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=2017-08-06}}</ref> There are water fountains at the playground at the north-west side of the lake and also at Innes Common.
There are also short bush walks and a small golf green on the west side of the lake.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://ketehamilton.peoplesnetworknz.info/documents/0000/0000/0084/Hamilton_Lake__Rotoroa__Timeline.pdf Hamilton Kete - timeline of reserve history from 1800] *[http://hamilton.recollect.co.nz/nodes/view/919 86 photos of lake] *[http://hamiltonheritagecollections.co.nz/nodes/view/1384#idx3050 1928 photo of swimmers]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Rotoroa, Lake}} [[Category:Geography of Hamilton, New Zealand]] [[Category:Lakes of Waikato]]
{{Waikato-geo-stub}}

page.title: List of Latin names of lakes

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=July 2012}}
The following is a non-exhaustive list of [[Geography in medieval Islam|Muslim geographers]].
*[[Muhammad ibn Mūsā al-Khwārizmī|Al-Khwarizmi]] (Algoritmi, 780-850) *[[Al-Kindi]] (Alkindus, 801-873) *[[Ya'qubi]] (died 897) *[[Ibn Khordadbeh]] (820-912) *[[Al-Dinawari]] (820-898) *[[Ahmed ibn Sahl al-Balkhi]] (850-934) *[[Khashkhash Ibn Saeed Ibn Aswad]] ([[floruit|fl.]] 889) *[[Abū Muhammad al-Hasan al-Hamdānī|Hamdani]] (893-945) *[[Abu al-Hasan 'Alī al-Mas'ūdī|Ali al-Masudi]] (896-956) *[[Ibn al-Faqih]] (10th century) *[[Ahmad ibn Fadlan]] (10th century) *[[Ahmad ibn Rustah]] (10th century) *[[Al-Muqaddasi]] (945-1000) *[[Ibn Hawqal]] (died after 977) *[[Ibn al-Haytham]] (Alhazen, 965-1039) *[[Abū Rayhān Bīrūnī]] (973-1048) *[[Avicenna|Ibn Sina]] (Avicenna, 980-1037) *[[Abu Said Gardezi]] (died 1061) *[[Abu Abdullah al-Bakri]] (1014–1094) *[[Muhammad al-Idrisi]] (Dreses, 1100–1165) *[[Averroes|Ibn Rushd]] (Averroes, 1126–1198) *[[Ibn Jubayr]] (1145–1217) *[[Yaqut al-Hamawi]] (1179–1229) *[[Abu al-Fida]] (Abulfeda, 1273–1331) *[[Hamdollah Mostowfi]] (1281–1349) *[[Ibn Battuta]] (1304-1370s) *[[Ahmad Bin Majid]] (born 1432) *[[Mahmud al-Kashgari]] (1005–1102) *[[Piri Reis]] (1465–1554) *[[Amin Razi]] (16th century) *[[Mohammad Reza Hafeznia]] (born 1955) *[[Ghazi Falah]] (born 20th century)
==See also== *[[Geography in medieval Islam]] *[[List of Arab scientists and scholars]]

page.title: List of airports by IATA code: G

revision.text:
{{Lists of airports by IATA code}} ==G== The DST column shows the months in which Daylight Saving Time, a.k.a. Summer Time, begins and ends. A blank DST box usually indicates that the location stays on Standard Time all year, although in some cases the location stays on Summer Time all year. If a location is currently on DST, add one hour to the time in the Time column. {{AlphanumericTOC|prefixLink=G|prefixDesc=G|numbers=|sections=}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:95%;" ! page.title: List of bodies of the European Union

revision.text:
{{Update|number of member states|date=January 2014}} Below is a list of [[bodies of the European Union]].
The first are the seven [[institutions of the European Union]] as listed in Article 13 of the [[Treaty of European Union]] (TEU).
Note that the [[European Atomic Energy Community]] (EURATOM) and [[European Space Agency]] (ESA) are not EU bodies.
{| class="wikitable sortable" ! Logo ! Name ! TEU ! Seat ! Members ! Chairman |- | [[File:Europarl logo.svg|100px]] |[[European Parliament|The European Parliament]] | 1 |[[Brussels]] & [[Strasbourg]] |785 MPs |[[Martin Schulz]] |- |[[File:Previous logo of European Council.svg|100px]] |[[European Council|The European Council]] | 2 |[[Brussels]] |28 Heads of State or Government of the Member States and the President of the Commission |[[Donald Tusk]] |- |[[File:Former logo of the European Council and Council of the European Union (2009).svg|100px]] |[[Council of the European Union|The Council of European Union]] | 3 |[[Brussels]] |28 ministers |Biannual rotation |- | |[[European Commission|The European Commission]] | 4 |[[Brussels]] |28 commissioners |[[Jean-Claude Juncker]] |- | |[[European Court of Justice|The European Court of Justice]] | 5 |[[Luxembourg]] |27 judges, 8 Advocate-Generals |[[Koen Lenaerts]] |- |[[File:Logo European Central Bank.svg|100px]] |[[European Central Bank|The European Central Bank]] | 6 |[[Frankfurt am Main]] | |[[Mario Draghi]] |- |  |[[Court of Auditors|The Court of Auditors]] | 7 |[[Brussels]] & [[Luxembourg]] |24 members, 1 president |[[Vítor Manuel da Silva Caldeira]] |- |<!--Don't use the non-free image: File:European Investment Bank (emblem).svg--> |[[European Investment Bank|The European Investment Bank]] | |[[Luxembourg]] |Owned by the EU member states |[[Werner Hoyer]] |- |<!--Don't use the non-free image: File:EESC logo.svg--> |[[Economic and Social Committee|The Economic and Social Committee]] | |[[Brussels]] |222 members |[[Georges Dassis]] |- |<!--Don't use the non-free image: File:European Ombudsman logo.svg--> |[[European Ombudsman|The European Ombudsman]] | |[[Strasbourg]] |Ombudsman & Secretary |[[Emily O'Reilly]] |- | |[[Committee of the Regions|The European Committee of the Regions]] | |[[Brussels]] |344 members |[[Markku Markkula]] |}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bodies of the European Union}} [[Category:Lists of organisations based in Europe|European Union institutions]] [[Category:European Union-related lists]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.1)
revision.text:
This is a list of [[cemetery|cemeteries]] in [[Budapest]], [[Hungary]]. The most famous of them is ''Kerepesi Cemetery'', one of the biggest national [[pantheon (structure)|pantheons]] in Europe, where several Hungarian notables are buried in ornate monuments. The second most significant may be ''Farkasréti Cemetery'', including the graves of further illustrious people.
The largest cemetery in Budapest (and one of the largest ones in Europe) is ''Új köztemető'' (New Public Cemetery); it comprises an area of about [[1 E6 m²|2.07 km²]].
* Angeli Street Cemetery * Budafoki Cemetery * Cinkotai Cemetery * Csepeli Cemetery * Csörsz Street Cemetery (Orthodox Jewish cemetery, out of use since 1961) * [[Farkasréti Cemetery]] * Gránátos Street Cemetery (Orthodox Jewish cemetery) * [[Kerepesi Cemetery]] (Kerepesi temető; official name: Fiumei úti sírkert) * Kispesti Cemetery * [[Kozma Street Cemetery]] (the biggest Jewish cemetery in Hungary, with the monument of 600,000 Jewish martyrs, famous for its [[art nouveau]] memorials) * [[New Public Cemetery, Budapest]] (Új köztemető; Rákoskeresztúri sírkert) * [[Óbuda Jewish Cemetery]] * Óbudai Cemetery * Pestszenterzsébeti Cemetery * Pestszentlőrinci Cemetery * Rákospalotai Cemetery * [[Salgotarjani Street Jewish Cemetery]] * Tamás Street Urn Cemetery * Újpest, Megyeri Cemetery
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050325224653/http://www.btirt.hu/temetok.html Budapest Funeral Institute, cemeteries]
[[Category:Cemeteries in Budapest|*]] [[Category:Lists of buildings and structures in Hungary|Cemeteries in Budapest]] [[Category:Religion in Budapest]] [[Category:Budapest-related lists|Cemeteries]]

page.title: List of mountains of Queen Maud Land

revision.text:
[[File:Jokolkyrkja.jpg|thumb|[[Jøkulkyrkja Mountain]] seen from the east. The summit is behind what seems like the highest peak to the right.]] This '''list of mountains of Queen Maud Land''' contains mountains with a registered elevation of higher than 2000 metres (6561 feet) above sea level. The availability of accurate data for this region is limited, making the list both incomplete and inaccurate. [[Prominence]] data is generally not available, and the list includes rock formations such as mountain peaks, ridges, [[nunatak]]s, cliffs and crags. [[Ice dome]]s are not included in the list.
With an elevation of {{convert|3148|m}},s [[Jøkulkyrkja Mountain]] is the highest mountain of [[Queen Maud Land]].<ref name="Njåstad" /> According to the [[United States Geological Survey]] (USGS) database [[Geographic Names Information System]] (GNIS) and other sources, several summits in the [[Sør Rondane Mountains]] are registered with higher elevation, including [[Isachsen Mountain]] (3,425 metres),<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 7366| name = Isachsen Mountain | accessdate = 2013-01-22}}</ref> [[Devold Peak]] (3,280 meters),<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 3812 | name = Devold Peak | accessdate = 2013-01-22}}</ref> [[Kjelbotn Peak]] (3,210 meters),<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 8022| name = Kjelbotn Peak | accessdate = 2013-01-22}}</ref> [[Bond Peaks]] (3,180 meters)<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 1629| name = Bond Peaks | accessdate = 2013-01-22}}</ref> and [[Mount Widerøe]] (3,180 meters).<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 16564| name = Widerøe, Mount | accessdate = 2013-01-22}}</ref> According to Belgian sources<ref>[http://homepages.ulb.ac.be/~fpattyn/belgianbase/sorrondane.html Background information on the Sør Rondane Mountains] Belgian Research Station Antarctica</ref> and Norwegian topographic maps<ref>[https://data.npolar.no/map/archive?q=s%C3%B8r-rondanel Norwegian Polar Institute map archive]</ref>, the highest elevation of Sør Rondane Mountains is just below 3000 m.a.s.l.
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Name ! Elevation (meters) ! Range ! Coordinates ! [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] ID ! [[Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research|SCAR]] ID |- | [[Devold Peak]] | 3280<ref name="GNIS" /> | [[Sør Rondane Mountains]] | General ecology and development of the Antarctic cold desert cryptogam formation."] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304031704/http://www.polarresearch.net/index.php/polar/article/download/6933/7766. |date=2016-03-04 }} ''Polar Research 4 n.s.'', p. 208.</ref> <ref name="Brunk">Brunk, K.(1986): ''[http://www.bkg.bund.de/nn_192790/DE/Bundesamt/Downloads/Kostenlose-Karten/Antarktis-Karten/Dokumentationen/Daten__PaPu/GeographischeNamen/DGK__1986__Reihe__E__Heft__24__Teil__1__Anlage__2.html Kartographische Arbeiten und deutsche Namengebung in Neuschwabenland, Antarktis] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116014654/http://www.bkg.bund.de/nn_192790/DE/Bundesamt/Downloads/Kostenlose-Karten/Antarktis-Karten/Dokumentationen/Daten__PaPu/GeographischeNamen/DGK__1986__Reihe__E__Heft__24__Teil__1__Anlage__2.html |date=2014-01-16 }}''. - Deutsche Geodätische Kommission, Series E: Volume 24, Part I Annex 2, Frankfurt am Main</ref> }}
