revision.text:
{{Cleanup|reason=Each decade may contain some duplication following a page merge; duplication should be corrected and tables expanded from the adjacent lists.|date=October 2017}} This is a '''timeline of country and capital changes''' around the world. It includes dates of [[declarations of independence]], [[geographical renaming|changes in country name]], changes of [[capital city]] or name, and significant [[Political history of the world|changes in territory]] (viz. land [[annexation]], [[cession]] or [[secession]]). __NOTOC__ ===Dates=== This article uses the [[Common Era|Common Calendar System]] which was established as the new [[Gregorian calendar|Christian Calendar]] by [[Pope Gregory XIII]] in 1582. The Common Calendar follows the [[ordinal number]]s rather than the [[cardinal number]]s, so there was no year "[[0 (number)|zero]]". The Common Calendar uses the designation [[Common Era]] ([[Common Era|CE]] or [[Anno Domini|AD]] for [[Anno Domini]]) for years starting January 1, 1 CE and [[Before Common Era]] ([[Before Common Era|BCE]] or [[Before Christ|BC]] for [[Before Christ]]) year before that date. (It is now known that [[Jesus of Nazareth]] was born a few years before that date, perhaps 4 BCE.) The date January 1, 1 CE immediately followed the date December 31, 1 BCE. Thus, while the [[Year 2000 problem|2000s]] began on Saturday, January 1, 2000 CE, the official [[3rd millennium|Third Millennium]] began on Monday, January 1, 2001 CE. ===Map changes=== Changes usually include (but are not limited to) the alteration of borders, the creation and fall of [[State (polity)|states]], changes of geographical names, as well as some unusually destructive natural disasters. Through the knowledge of such dates and events, the approximate year and age of a [[world map]] could be calculated and estimated. Not all maps of the world of an age or period will be the same throughout the globe as different [[cartography|mapmakers]] (or their employers) may have different views on the sovereignty or territorial integrity of the countries of the world or possess different levels of technological and geographical insight, the maps created by them might differ significantly.
''' [[#21st century|2000s]]   [[#1990s|1900s]]   [[#1890s|1800s]]   [[#18th century|1700s]]   [[#17th century|1600s]]   [[#16th century|1500s]]   [[#15th century|1400s]]   [[#14th century|1300s]]   [[#13th century|1200s]]   [[#12th century|1100s]]   [[#11th century|1000s]] 
 [[#990s|1st Millennium CE]]   [[#First Millennium BCE|1st Millennium BCE]]   [[#Second Millennium BCE|2nd Millennium BCE]]   [[#Third Millennium BCE|3rd Millennium BCE]]   [[#Fourth Millennium BCE|4th Millennium BCE]] ''' {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- style="text-align:center;" | style="width:96px; background:#dfd;"|Africa | style="width:96px; background:#fee;"|Asia | style="width:96px; background:#eef;"|Europe | style="width:96px; background:#eff;"|Oceania | style="width:96px; background:#ffd;"|North America | style="width:96px; background:#fed;"|South America | style="width:96px; background:#fff;"|Antarctica |}
==21st century== ===2010s=== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !style="width:6%"|Year||style="width:8%"|Date||style="width:86%"|Event |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"|2018 | align=center|October 3|| style="background:#eff;"|[[East Island, Hawaii]] is [[Coastal erosion|washed away]] due to [[Hurricane Walaka]].{{cite web |title=Remote Hawaiian Island Wiped Off The Map |first1=Chris |last1=D'Angelo |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/hawaii-east-island-lost-to-hurricane-walaka-french-frigate-shoals-climate-change_us_5bcf2a8ee4b055bc9484e803 |publisher=[[Huffington Post]] |accessdate=23 October 2018 |date=23 October 2018}} |- | align=center|July 9|| style="background:#dfd;"|'''[[Ethiopia]]''' ends its occupation of [[Badme]] and returns the town to '''[[Eritrea]]''' following a [[2018 Eritrea–Ethiopia summit|peace summit]], ending their 20-year [[Eritrean–Ethiopian border conflict|border conflict]]. |- | align=center|April 19|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[Swaziland|Kingdom of Swaziland]] changes its name to the '''[[Eswatini|Kingdom of Eswatini]]'''. [[Mbabane]] remains the capital.{{cite web |title=The World Factbook - What's New |url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/docs/whatsnew.html |publisher=[[Central Intelligence Agency]] |accessdate=11 June 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180611064949/https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/docs/whatsnew.html |archivedate=11 June 2018}} |- | align=center|February 2|| style="background:#ffd;"|The [[International Court of Justice|International Court of Justice (ICJ)]] rules that a strip of northern [[Isla Calero|Isla Portillos]] of at the mouth of the [[San Juan River (Nicaragua)|San Juan River]] in '''[[Nicaragua]]''' belongs to '''[[Costa Rica]]'''.Map: Costa Rica & Nicaragua Settle Border Dispute in Court. (2018). Polgeonow.com. Retrieved 4 February 2018, from http://www.polgeonow.com/2018/02/nicaragua-costa-rica-border-dispute-ruling-icj-2018.html |- | align=center|January 1|| style="background:#eef;"|'''[[Belgium]]''' and '''[[The Netherlands]]''' finalize an exchange of territory along the [[Meuse River]].{{cite web|last=Staudenmaier|first=Rebecca|title=Belgium And Netherlands Swap Land In The New Year|date=January 1, 2018|website=[[Deutsche Welle]]|url=http://www.dw.com/en/belgium-and-netherlands-swap-land-in-the-new-year/a-41988494}} The agreement, initially signed on November 28, 2016, involves a one-for-two swap of three tiny islands, with the Netherlands gaining {{convert |24.7 | acres |ha}} of land near [[Oost-Maarland]], so that [[enclaves and exclaves|pene-exclaves]] caused by the straightening of the Meuse can be fixed. Presqu'ile de L'llal and Presqu'ile d'Eijsden, which were formerly Belgian, were swapped for a former Dutch piece of land, Presqu'ile Petit-Gravier.{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2016/11/28/Netherlands-to-grow-247-acres-in-land-swap-with-Belgium/9481480343727/|title=Netherlands to grow 24.7 acres in land swap with Belgium|website=[[UPI]]|last=Cone|first=Allen|date=November 28, 2016}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|2017 |align=center|June 24|| style="background:#fee;"|[[Egypt]] transfers sovereignty of [[Sanafir Island]] and [[Tiran Island]] to [[Saudi Arabia]]. |- |align=center|April 9|| style="background:#fee;"|Following a [[South Ossetian name change referendum, 2017|referendum]], the [[South Ossetia|Republic of South Ossetia]] changes its name to the '''[[South Ossetia|Republic of South Ossetia–the State of Alania]]'''. |- |align=center|February 21|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[Nagorno-Karabakh Republic]] changes its name to the '''[[Republic of Artsakh]]''' a day after a [[Nagorno-Karabakh constitutional referendum, 2017|constitutional referendum]] takes place. The [[Republic of Azerbaijan]] continues to consider Nagorno-Karabakh as part of its sovereign territory, a position shared by the United Nations.{{cite news|url=http://www.rferl.org/a/nagorno-karabakh-referendum-azerbaijan-armenia/28323000.html |title=Azerbaijan's Breakaway Nagorno-Karabakh Holds 'Illegal' Referendum |publisher=Radio Free Europe |date=21 February 2017 |accessdate=20 September 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://armenianweekly.com/2017/02/21/artsakh-votes-for-new-constitution-officially-renames-the-republic/ |title=Artsakh Votes for New Constitution, Officially Renames the Republic |publisher=The Armenian Weekly |date=22 February 2017 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} |- |align=center|January 29|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[Islamic Republic of The Gambia]] changes its name back to the '''[[The Gambia|Republic of The Gambia]]'''.{{cite web|title=Adama Barrow removes Islamic from Gambia's name|url=https://www.naij.com/1085177-adama-barrow-removes-islamic-gambias-name.html|date=January 29, 2017|last=Adegun|first=Aanu|website=[[Naij]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/adama-barrow-removes-islamic-gambias-official-name-1603686|title=Adama Barrow removes 'Islamic' from The Gambia's official name|first=Vasudevan|last=Sridharan|date=29 January 2017|website=[[International Business Times]]}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan=1|2016||align=center|May 2|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Czech Republic]] votes to adopt '''[[Name of the Czech Republic|Czechia]]''' as its official short-form name in English.{{cite web|title=Vláda schválila doplnení jednoslovného názvu Cesko v cizích jazycích do databází OSN|date=May 5, 2016|url=https://www.mzv.cz/jnp/cz/udalosti_a_media/archiv_zprav/rok_2016/tiskove_zpravy/x_2016_05_02_vlada_schvalila_czechia.html|language=Czech|website=Ministerstvo zahraničních věcí České republiky|access-date=August 28, 2018|trans-title=The government has approved the addition of one-word Czech name in foreign languages to UN databases}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="6"|2015||align=center|December 16|| style="background:#ffd;"|The [[International Court of Justice|International Court of Justice (ICJ)]] cedes 3 km2 to [[Costa Rica]], resolving the [[Costa Rica–Nicaragua San Juan River border dispute]] with [[Nicaragua]].{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/16/costa-rica-nicaragua-border-dispute-icj-international-court-of-justice|title=Judges side with Costa Rica in territorial dispute with Nicaragua|first=|last=AFP|date=16 December 2015|publisher=|via=The Guardian}} |- |align=center|December 11|| style="background:#dfd;"|By presidential decree, the [[Republic of The Gambia]] changes its name to the '''[[The Gambia|Islamic Republic of The Gambia]]'''.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/12/gambia-now-an-islamic-republic-says-president-yahya-jammeh|title=The Gambia now an Islamic republic, says President Yahya Jammeh|author1=Staff|author2=agencies|date=11 December 2015|website=The Guardian}}Rifai, Ryan (12 December 2015) [http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/12/gambia-president-declares-islamic-statehood-151212153025585.html "Gambia's president declares Islamic statehood"]. [[Al-Jazeera]]. Retrieved 2 September 2016. |- |align=center|November 12|| style="background:#fee;"|[[Pakistan]] formally agrees to lease its [[Gwadar Port]] to [[China]] until 2059.{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-news-india/pakistan-hands-over-2000-acres-to-china-in-gwadar-port-city/|title=Pakistan hands over 2000 acres to China in Gwadar port city|agency=[[Press Trust of India|PTI]]|website=[[The Indian Express]]|date=November 12, 2015|access-date=August 28, 2018}} |- |align=center|June 6|| style="background:#fee;"|'''[[India]]''' and '''[[Bangladesh]]''' exchange [[India–Bangladesh enclaves|162 enclaves]] along their borders, simplifying the border.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-33033342|title=India and Bangladesh sign historic territory swap deal |work=BBC News|date=June 6, 2015}} |- |align=center|May 8|| style="background:#dfd;"|[[Niger]] and [[Burkina Faso]], in continuation with the implementation of the judgement of the [[International Court of Justice]] concerning the 2013 [[Burkina Faso–Niger Frontier Dispute case]], agreed to exchange 18 towns over the following year (Burkina Faso to gain 14, Niger to gain four).{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/may/08/burkina-faso-niger-exchange-18-towns-settle-border-dispute|title=Burkina Faso and Niger exchange 18 towns to settle border dispute|website=[[The Guardian]]|date=May 8, 2015|access-date=August 28, 2018|agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]}} |- |align=center|March 21|| style="background:#fee;"|After the [[2014–15 Yemeni coup d'état]], the capital of [[Yemen]] is provisionally moved from [[Sana'a]] to [[Aden]]. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"|2014 |align=center|May 11|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Donetsk People's Republic]]''' and '''[[Luhansk People's Republic]]''' declare their independence from [[Ukraine]] following a [[Donbass status referendums, 2014|status referendum]]. [[Donetsk]] and [[Luhansk]] are proclaimed as their capitals. The referendum's results and the so-called republics' declarations were internationally unrecognized. |- |align=center|March 18|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Republic of Crimea (country)|Republic of Crimea]] [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|was annexed]] by the '''[[Russian Federation]]''' as [[Federal subjects of Russia|two separate federal entities]]: the [[Republics of Russia|Republic of]] [[Republic of Crimea|Crimea]] and the [[Federal cities of Russia|city of federal significance]] [[Sevastopol]]. Ukraine itself and much of the international community maintain that Crimea is illegally occupied by Russia and legally remains an integral region of Ukraine.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/18/world/europe/ukraine-crisis/|title=Ukraine cries 'robbery' as Russia annexes Crimea|first1=Matt|last1=Smith|first2=Alla|last2=Eshchenko|date=18 March 2014|website=[[CNN]]}} |- |align=center|January 27|| style="background:#fed;"|The [[Chilean–Peruvian maritime dispute|maritime dispute between Chile and Peru]] is resolved.{{cite web|url=http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/137/17930.pdf|title=Judgment of the ICJ about the maritime dispute between Peru and Chile|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150210084913/http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/137/17930.pdf|archivedate=2015-02-10|df=}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"|2013||align=center|October 24|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[Republic of Cape Verde]] decrees the official English-language rendering of its name to be the '''[[Republic of Cabo Verde]]''',{{cite web|url=http://www.panapress.com/Cape-Verde-changes-name-to--Cabo-Verde---13-885619-0-lang2-index.html|title=Cape Verde changes name to "Cabo Verde"|website=[[PanaPress]]|date=October 30, 2013|access-date=August 28, 2018}} following precedents set by [[Côte d'Ivoire]] and [[East Timor|Timor-Leste]] (neither of which use English as an [[official language]]). |- |align=center|September 28|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[United Federated States of Bangsamoro Republik]] ceases to exist with the [[Zamboanga City crisis|loss of Zamboanga City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/09/28/13/palace-zamboanga-crisis-over |title=Zamboanga crisis is over, Palace: Zamboanga crisis is over |publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' |date=September 28, 2013 |accessdate=September 28, 2013 |author=Reuters |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130929153614/http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/09/28/13/palace-zamboanga-crisis-over |archivedate=September 29, 2013 }} |- |align=center|July 27|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[United Federated States of Bangsamoro Republik]] declares independence from the Philippines and claims all of [[Malaysian Borneo]].{{Cite web|url=http://mnlfnet.com/Articles/Editorial_14Aug2013_Who%20is%20Afraid%20of%20Mindanao%20Independence_Prologue.htm|date=August 14, 2013|accessdate=November 19, 2013|title=WHO IS AFRAID OF MINDANAO INDEPENDENCE?|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130915073150/http://mnlfnet.com/Articles/Editorial_14Aug2013_Who%20is%20Afraid%20of%20Mindanao%20Independence_Prologue.htm|archivedate=September 15, 2013|df=}} |- |align=center|April 16|| style="background:#dfd;"|A [[Burkina Faso–Niger Frontier Dispute case|border dispute]] between [[Niger]] and [[Burkina Faso]] is finally resolved, resulting in minor changes to the previously recognized border. |- |align=center|January 7|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[Libyan national congress|Libyan National Congress]] unofficially changes the name of the country from [[Libya]] to the '''[[State of Libya]]''', which will be used until a new constitution is adopted.{{cite web|url=http://english.ruvr.ru/2013_01_09/Libyan-Parliament-approves-decision-to-give-up-Great-Jamahiriya-name/|title=Libyan Parliament approves decision to give up Great Jamahiriya name|date=January 9, 2013|access-date=August 28, 2018|archive-date=January 16, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116150834/http://english.ruvr.ru/2013_01_09/Libyan-Parliament-approves-decision-to-give-up-Great-Jamahiriya-name/|website=[[The Voice of Russia]]}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="7"|2012||align=center|November 29|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[United Nations]] votes to upgrade the status of '''[[State of Palestine|Palestine]]''' from "entity" to "non-member observer state," effectively granting it recognition.{{cite web|url=http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2012/11/29/15546351-un-upgrades-palestinian-status-bolstering-statehood-claim?lite|title=UN upgrades Palestinian status, bolstering statehood claim|author=World News|date=30 July 2015|work=NBC News|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121201043631/http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2012/11/29/15546351-un-upgrades-palestinian-status-bolstering-statehood-claim?lite|archivedate=1 December 2012|df=}} |- |align=center|November 19|| style="background:#ffd;"|Judgment of the ICJ about the [[Territorial disputes of Nicaragua#Colombia|maritime dispute between Nicaragua and Colombia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/124/17162.pdf|title=Judgment of the ICJ about the maritime dispute between Nicaragua and Colombia|publisher=}} |- |align=center|August 20|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[Somali Republic]] changes its name to the '''[[Federal Republic of Somalia]]'''. |- |align=center|July 12|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[State of Azawad]] capitulates and is taken over by [[Ansar Dine]], an Islamist group aiming for establishing Mali as an Islamist state, effectively being reabsorbed by the '''[[Republic of Mali]]'''.{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20120712-al-qaeda-linked-islamists-drive-malis-tuaregs-last-stronghold-ansogo-timbuktu-mnla-ansar-dine-mujao|title=Al Qaeda-linked Islamists drive Mali's Tuaregs from last stronghold|website=[[France 24]]|date=July 12, 2012|access-date=August 28, 2018|agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]}} |- |align=center|May 26|| style="background:#fee;"|'''[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]''' moves its legislative capital from [[Tbilisi]] to [[Kutaisi]]. Tbilisi remains the administrative capital. |- |align=center|April 6|| style="background:#dfd;"|[[Azawad]] proclaims its independence from the [[Republic of Mali]] as the '''[[State of Azawad]]'''{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/africa/2012/04/20124644412359539.html|title=Tuaregs claim 'independence' from Mali|website=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=April 6, 2012}} with [[Timbuktu]] as its capital. |- |align=center|January 1|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Third Hungarian Republic|Hungarian Republic]] changes its name to '''[[Hungary]]'''.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/blogpost/post/hungary-loses-republic-name-and-protests-fill-capital/2012/01/03/gIQAYCaMYP_blog.html|title=Hungary loses ‘Republic’ in name, and protests [[Prague]] remains the capital. |- | style="background:#dfd;"|Independence of the [[State of Katanga]] from the [[Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)]] with no recognition |- |align=center|July 1|| style="background:#dfd;"|The '''[[Somali Republic]]''' ([[Somalia]]) is created from a merger of the former colonies of [[British Somaliland]] and [[Italian Somaliland]]. The capital is [[Benghazi]]. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan=21|1948||align=center|November 26|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the autonomous state of '''[[East Java]]''' is established. |- |align=center|September 20|| style="background:#ffd;"|Reorganization and naming of the [[Dutch colonies]]. *[[Curaçao and Dependencies]] is renamed the '''[[Netherlands Antilles]]''', as its dependencies gain equality in level of sovereignty. |- |align=center|September 12|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[State of Hyderabad]] is reintegrated back into the [[Indian Union]]. |- |align=center|September 9|| style="background:#fee;"|[[Korea]] is [[Division of Korea|divided between]] the '''[[North Korea|Democratic People's Republic of Korea]]''' ([[North Korea]]) and the '''[[South Korea|Republic of Korea]]''' ([[South Korea]]). [[Pyongyang]] and [[Seoul]] are the respective capitals. |- |align=center|August 30|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the '''[[South Sumatra|State of South Sumatra]]''' is established. |- |align=center|August 15|| style="background:#fee;"|Establishment of the '''[[Republic of Korea]]''' out of British/American/United Nations occupied Korea (South Korea). |- |align=center|July 17|| style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Republic of the Philippines]]''' moves its capital from [[Manila]] to [[Quezon City]]. |- |align=center|May 14|| style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[State of Israel]]''' is established upon the termination of the [[Mandatory Palestine|British Mandate for Palestine]]. [[Tel Aviv]] is the capital.{{cite web|url=http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/un/res181.htm|title=The Avalon Project : UN General Assembly Resolution 181|work=yale.edu|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061029150108/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/un/res181.htm|archivedate=2006-10-29|df=}} |- |align=center|April 24|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the [[West Java|State of West Java]] is renamed the '''[[West Java|Sundanese State]]'''. |- |align=center|April 18|| style="background:#eef;"|'''[[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]''' is [[Republic of Ireland Act 1948|declared a republic]]. |- |align=center|April 1|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Faroe Islands]]''' becomes a self-governing dependency. |- |align=center|March 27|| style="background:#fee;"|[[Khanate of Kalat|Kalat State]] is integrated into the [[Dominion of Pakistan]]. |- |align=center|February 26|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the '''[[West Java|State of West Java]]''' is created. |- | rowspan="2" align="center" |February 4|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[Crown Colony]] of [[British Ceylon|Ceylon]] ([[Sri Lanka]]) gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]] as the '''[[Dominion of Ceylon]]'''. [[Colombo]] remains the capital until 1982. |- | style="background:#fee;" |In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the [[East Kalimantan|Siak Besar Territory]] is renamed the '''[[East Kalimantan|Federation of East Kalimantan]]'''. |- |align=center|January 30|| style="background:#fee;"|In the United Kingdom, the [[Malayan Union]] is renamed the '''[[Federation of Malaya]]'''. |- | rowspan="2" align="center" |January 23|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the states of [[Bangka Regency|Bangka Council]], the [[Belitung|Belitung Council]], and the [[Riau Sultanate#Riau Hall|Riau Council]] are merged as the '''[[Bangka–Belitung Islands|Bangka Belitung and Riau Federation]]'''. |- | style="background:#fee;" |In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the autonomous '''[[Madura|State of Madura]]''' is created. |- |align=center|January 14|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the autonomous state of the '''[[Banjar Regency|Territory of Banjar]]''' is created. |- |align=center|January 4|| style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Union of Burma]]''' gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]]. [[Yangon]] (British [[Rangoon]]) is the capital until 2005. |- |align=center| ? || style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen]]''' ([[North Yemen]]) moves its capital from [[Sana'a]] to [[Taiz]]. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="20"|1947||align=center|December 30|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Romanian People's Republic]]''' supersedes the [[Kingdom of Romania]]. [[Bucharest]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|December 26|| style="background:#fff;"|Sovereignty over the '''[[Territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands]]''' is transferred from the [[United Kingdom]] to [[Australia]]. |- |align=center|December 25|| style="background:#fee;"|In the [[Dutch East Indies]], the [[East Sumatra|Special Territory of East Sumatra]] is renamed the '''[[East Sumatra|State of East Sumatra]]'''. |- |align=center|December 15|| style="background:#eef;"|[[France]] claims the '''[[Saar (protectorate)|Saar]]''' as a protectorate from allied-occupied [[Germany]]. |- |align=center|November 25|| style="background:#eff;"|The [[Dominion of New Zealand]] ceases to be a dominion of the [[British Empire]]. |- |align=center|November 1|| style="background:#eff;"|The League of Nations Mandate of '''[[Nauru]]''' is transferred as a United Nations Trust Territory. |- |align=center|October 27|| style="background:#fee;"|The princely state of '''[[Jammu and Kashmir (princely state)|Jammu and Kashmir]]''' is divided between [[India]] and [[Pakistan]].{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Ek00fuXVz1wC|title=Kashmir in Conflict: India, Pakistan and the Unending War|last=Schofield|first=Victoria|date=2000-01-01|publisher=I. Kingdom]]. |- |align=center|July 18|| style="background:#eff;"|The [[South Pacific Mandate|South Pacific (League of Nations) Mandate]], governed by Japan, is transferred to the [[Trust Territory of [[Tirana]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|January 4|| style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Republic of Indonesia]]''' moves its capital from [[Jakarta]] to [[Yogyakarta (city)|Yogyakarta]]. |- | rowspan="61" |1945 |December 29 |The [[Netherlands New Guinea|'''Netherlands New Guinea''']] is separated from the [[Dutch East Indies]]. |- |December 26 |The [[People's Republic of Poland|'''Republic of Poland''']] becomes independent. |- | align="center" |December 2|| style="background:#eef;" |The '''[[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia]]''' supersedes the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia]]. [[Belgrade]] remains the capital. |- |November 29 |The [[Democratic Federal Yugoslavia]] is renamed the [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|'''Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia''']]. [[Belgrade]] remains the capital. |- |November |The Soviet Union invades northwest Iran and creates the puppet state of the [[Azerbaijan People's Government|'''Azerbaijan People's Government''']]. |- |October 25 |In [[occupied Japan]], [[Taiwan under Japanese rule|Taiwan]] is given to the [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]]. |- |October 17 |The Soviet Union annexes northern East Prussia. |- |October 16 |The Japanese puppet state of the [[Japanese occupation of Cambodia#Pro-Tokyo puppet state|Kingdom of Cambodia]] is taken over by France and put back under French Indochina. |- |October 10 |In occupied Japan, the [[Banaba Island]] is given back over by the [[Gilbert and Ellice Islands]] under the United Kingdom. |- |October 7 |In occupied Japan, the [[Andaman and Nicobar Islands]] are given back to the [[British Raj]]. |- |October |In occupied Japan, [[Christmas Island]] is given back to the United Kingdom. |- |September 23 |The [[Kingdom of Laos]], which was under Japanese occupation, is taken back by France as part of [[French Indochina]]. |- |September 16 |The [[British occupation of the Faroe Islands]] ends and is handed back to Denmark. |- |September 15 |The Soviet Union's occupation over the [[People's Republic of Korea]] ends. |- |September 13 |[[Nauru]] is taken back over by allied forces and is put under a U.N. trusteeship administered by Australia, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. |- | rowspan="2" |September 12 |[[British Malaya|Malaya]] is given back to the United Kingdom from occupied Japan and is split into the [[Federated Malay States|'''Federated Malay States''']] and the [[Johor|'''State of Johor Darul Ta'zim''']]. |- |[[Japanese occupation of Singapore|Syonan-to]] is taken back over by the United Kingdom from Japan as the [[Straits Settlements|'''Straits Settlements''']]. [[Singapore in the Straits Settlements|Singapore]] is the capital. |- |September 11 |In occupied Japan, [[Timor]] is split between the Portuguese [[Portuguese Timor|'''East Timor''']] and the Dutch [[Dutch East Indies|'''West Timor''']] |- |September 10 |[[Japanese occupation of British Borneo|Bourneo Kita]] and the occupation of the British protectorate of the Kingdom of Sarawak are taken back over by the United Kingdom as [[North Borneo|'''North Borneo''']]. |- |September 9 |[[Reorganized National Government of China|Nanjing]] is taken over by the Republic of China. |- | rowspan="2" align="center" |September 8|| style="background:#fee;" |The [[Thailand|Kingdom of Thailand]] changes its name back to the '''[[Thailand|Kingdom of Siam]]'''. [[Bangkok]] remains the capital. |- |The following states were freed from the [[Empire of Japan]] (which became [[Occupation of Japan|occupied]]), and became their own states from Malaya: * [[Kedah|State of Kedah Darul Aman]] * [[Kelantan|State of Kelantan Darul Naim]] * [[Perlis|State of Perlis Indera Kayangan]] * [[Terengganu|State of Terengganu Darul Iman]] |- |September 4 |The United States occupies [[Wake Island]] from Japan. |- |September 3 |The United States occupies the [[Bonin Islands]] and [[Volcano Islands]] from Japan. |- | rowspan="3" style="text-align:center;" |September 2|| style="background:#fee;" |The '''[[Democratic Republic of Vietnam]]''' declares its independence from the [[French Republic]]. [[Hanoi]] is the capital. |- | style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Empire of Japan]]''' surrenders to [[Allies of World War II|Allied Forces]]. |- |The capital of the Republic of China is moved from [[Chongqing]] back to [[Nanking]]. |- |September |The Concessions of [[Shanghai French Concession|Shanghai]], [[Concessions in Tianjin#French concession (1860–1946)|Tientsin]], and [[Guangzhouwan]] are re-controlled by France from Japan. |- |August 28 |[[British Hong Kong]] becomes a crown colony. |- |August 22 |The [[Kwantung Leased Territory]] is given to the Republic of China. |- |August 18 |The Japanese create a separate political entity for the [[Andaman and Nicobar Islands]]. |- | rowspan="2" align="center" |August 17|| style="background:#fee;" |The '''[[Republic of Indonesia]]''' declares its independence from the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands]]. [[Jakarta]] is the capital. |- |The [[Commonwealth of the Philippines]] takes over the Japanese occupied independent [[Second Philippine Republic|Republic of the Philippines]]. |- |August 16 |Hong Kong is liberated from Japan by allied forces and put under [[British Hong Kong|British rule]]. |- | rowspan="3" align="center" |August 15|| style="background:#fee;" |'''[[Korea]]''' gains independence from the [[Empire of Japan]]. [[Seoul]] is the capital. |- |The [[Great Empire of Manchuria]] is taken over by the Soviet Union. |- |[[French Indochina|'''French Indochina''']] is recovered by France. |- |August 11 |The Japanese occupied [[Empire of Vietnam]] is taken back over by France. |- |June 29 |A treaty is signed between the Soviet Union and [[Third Czechoslovak Republic|Czechoslovakia]] having the Soviet Union annex [[Subcarpathian Ruthenia]]. |- |June 14 |The [[State of Brunei]] is retaken by the United Kingdom and is classified as a protectorate. |- |May 13 |The [[Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia]] is integrated back into [[Third Czechoslovak Republic|Czechoslovakia]]. |- | rowspan="2" |May 9 |[[Reichskommissariat Norwegen]] (Norway) is liberated by allied forces and is given back its possessions. ([[Bouvet Island]], [[Peter I Island]], and [[Queen Maud Land]]) |- |The [[Channel Islands]] are liberated from Nazi Germany to the United Kingdom as the [[Bailiwick of Guernsey|'''Bailiwick of Guernsey''']] and the [[Jersey|'''Bailiwick of Jersey''']]. |- | rowspan="2" align="center" |May 8|| style="background:#eef;" |The '''[[Nazi Germany|Greater German Empire]]''' surrenders to the [[Allies of World War II|Allied Forces]]. |- |The [[Independent State of Croatia]] is taken over by the Allied Forces and given back to [[Yugoslavia]]. |- |May 7 |The [[Dodecanese Islands]] are taken over by the Allied Forces and given to [[Greece]]. |- | rowspan="2" |May 5 |The [[Occupation of Denmark|occupation]] of the [[Kingdom of Denmark]] by the [[Flensburg Government]] (while given back [[Greenland]] from United States protection) ends. |- |The [[Reichskommissariat Niederlande]] (the [[Netherlands]]) is liberated and the colonies loyal to the government in exile of [[Curaçao|Curaçao and Dependencies]] and the [[Surinam (Dutch colony)|Surinam]] are merged to form the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands|'''Kingdom of the Netherlands''']]. |- |May 1 |Due to the death of [[Adolf Hitler]] and the allied victory of the [[Battle of Berlin]], the government was moved to [[Flensburg]] and the [[Flensburg Government|'''Flensburg Government''']] was created. |- |align=center|April 27|| style="background:#eef;"|The second '''[[Republic of Austria]]''' is established in occupied Austria. [[Vienna]] is the capital. The independence is recognised by the [[Allies of World War II|Allied Forces]]. |- |April 25 |The [[Italian Social Republic]] is taken over from Nazi Germany and given to the [[Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)|Kingdom of Italy]]. |- |April 8 |The [[Kingdom of Laos]] declares independence under Japanese occupation, while Japanese [[Indochina]] ceases to exist as a political entity. |- |April 4 |The [[Slovak Republic (1939–1945)|Slovak Republic]] is liberated and given to the [[Third Czechoslovak Republic|Czechoslovak Republic]]. |- | rowspan="2" |April 3 |The [[Third Czechoslovak Republic|Czechoslovak Republic]] is liberated from Nazi Germany. |- |The United States takes over the [[Ryukyu Islands]] and administers it as the [[United States Civil Administration of the Ryukyu Islands|'''United States Civil Administration of the Ryukyu Islands''']]. |- |March 27 |The [[State of Burma]] is taken back over by allied forces and becomes the British crown colony of [[British Burma|'''Burma''']]. |- |March 20 |France regains [[Alsace-Lorraine]]. |- |March 18 |The [[Kingdom of Cambodia]] declares independence from Japan under its occupation. |- |March 11 |The [[Empire of Vietnam]] declares independence from Japan under its occupation. |- |March 8 |The [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920–1946)|Kingdom of Hungary]] is liberated from Nazi Germany. |- |January 17 |The Polish area of the [[General Government]] is liberated from Nazi Germany by the Allied Forces. |- |align=center|1944||align=center|June 17|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Kingdom of Iceland]]''' ends its [[personal union]] with the [[Kingdom of Denmark]] and becomes a republic. [[Reykjavík]] remains the capital. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|1943||align=center|November 22|| style="background:#fee;"|The '''[[Lebanese Republic]]''' ([[Lebanon]]) gains independence from the [[French Republic]]. [[Beirut]] is the capital. |- |align=center|January|| style="background:#dfd;"|The French '''[[Fezzan-Ghadames (French Administration)|Military Territory of Fezzan-Ghadames]]''' is created when Free French forces from [[Chad]] invade southern [[Italian Libya]]. [[Sabha, Libya|Sabha]] is the capital. |- |align=center|1942||align=center|November|| style="background:#dfd;"|The '''[[British Military Administration (Libya)|British Military Administration of Libya]]''' begins when British forces invade [[Cyrenaica]] from [[Egypt]]. |- | rowspan="8" |1940 |June 7 |The [[Reichskommissariat Norwegen|Realm Commissariat for the Occupied Norwegian Territories]] is created when German forces invade the [[Kingdom of Norway]] and its possessions. [[Oslo]] is the capital. |- |May 17 |The '''[[Military Administration in Belgium and Northern France]]''' and the [[Reichskommissariat of Belgium and Northern France|'''Realm Commissariat of Belgium and Northern France''']] are created when German forces invade the [[Belgium|Kingdom of Belgium]]. [[Brussels]] is the capital. |- |May 14 |The [[Reichskommissariat Niederlande|'''Reich Commissariat for the Occupied Dutch Territories''']] is created when German forces invade the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands]]. [[Amsterdam]] is the capital. |- |May 10 |The '''[[Military Administration of Luxembourg]]''' and the '''[[Civil Administration Area of Luxembourg]]''' are created when German forces invade the [[Grand Duchy of Luxembourg]]. [[Luxembourg City]] is the capital. |- |April 12 |The '''[[Faroe Islands]]''' are put under British occupation. |- |April 9 |The '''[[Kingdom of Denmark]]''' is taken over by German forces, while [[Greenland]] is granted autonomy. |- |March 30 |The [[Provisional Government of the Republic of China (1937–1940)|Provisional Government of China]] and the [[Reformed Government of the Republic of China]] merge to form the '''[[Reorganized National Government of China]]'''. |- |March 12 |The '''[[Karelo-Finnish Soviet Socialist Republic]]''' is formed when Soviet forces invade the [[Finnish Democratic Republic]]. [[Petrozavodsk]] is the capital. |} =====1946===== *Transfer of League of Nations Mandates to United Nations Trust Territories: **December 16 — [[British Cameroons]] and [[Cameroun]] (French administered) **December 13 — [[British Togoland]], [[French Togoland]], and the Belgian administered [[Ruanda-Urundi]] **December 11 — [[Tanganyika Territory]] is renamed [[Tanganyika]] (British administered) **December 8 — [[Territory of New Guinea]] (Australian administered) [[File:Colonization 1945.png|thumb|220px|right|World map of colonisation in 1945.]] =====1944===== *December 31 — The [[People's Republic of Poland|Republic of Poland]] gains independence *December 15 — The [[Kingdom of Montenegro]], a puppet state of [[Italian Social Republic]] (which is a puppet state of Nazi Germany), is taken over by allied forces *November 13 — The [[Independent State of Macedonia]] is liberated from axis powers, and Yugoslavia takes it back *November 12 — The [[Second East Turkestan Republic|East Turkestan Republic]] declares independence from the Republic of China *November 3 — The [[Hellenic State (1941–1944)|Hellenic State]] is completely liberated from the axis powers, with the [[Kingdom of Greece]] taken over the rest of it *October 20 **The [[Albanian Kingdom (1943–1944)|Albanian Kingdom]] is liberated from the axis powers as the [[Democratic Government of Albania]] **The [[Military Administration in Serbia]] is liberated from the axis powers, and Yugoslavia takes it back over *October 16 — The [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920–1946)|Kingdom of Hungary]] becomes a puppet state of Nazi Germany, keeping the name of the [[Government of National Unity (Hungary)|Kingdom of Hungary]] *October 13 **The [[Kingdom of Greece]] returns to power after [[Athens]] is recovered **The [[Reichskommissariat Ostland]] is completely taken over by allied forces, and integrated into the Soviet Union *October 11 — The Soviet Union annexes the [[Tuvan People's Republic]] *September 11 — The [[Grand Duchy of Luxembourg]] is liberated from Nazi Germany *September 8 — The [[Independent State of Macedonia]] is created in Bulgarian controlled Macedonia *September 3 — The [[Military Administration in Belgium and North France]] are liberated from Nazi Germany and the [[Kingdom of Belgium]] is reformed, as [[Belgian Congo]] is put under the Belgian government control after being loyal to the government in exile *August 20 — The [[Vichy France|French State (Vichy France)]] is renamed the [[Provisional Government of the French Republic]]. All of its colonies remained loyal to the [[Free French Forces]] until Vichy France was disestablished, and [[Clipperton Island]] is returned *August 10 — [[Omiya Jima]] is taken over by the United States from Japan *February 2 — The [[Reichskommissariat Ukraine]] (Ukraine) is taken back over by the Soviet Union =====1943===== *December 1 — The [[Italian Social Republic|National Republic State of Italy]] is renamed the [[Italian Social Republic]] *November 22 — The [[Mandate of Syria]], made up of the [[French Mandate of Lebanon|State of Greater Lebanon]] and the [[French Mandate of Syria|Syrian Republic]], are given independence as the [[Lebanese Republic]] and the [[Syrian Republic (1930-58)|Syrian Republic]], respectively *October 23 — The [[Andaman and Nicobar Islands]] are taken back over by allied forces *October 14 — The [[Japanese occupation of the Philippines|Philippines]] under the Japanese, is given independence as the [[Second Philippine Republic|Republic of the Philippines]] *September 23 — The part of Italy under German occupation is made into a separate country as the [[Italian Social Republic|National Republican State of Italy]] *September 11 — The [[Dodecanese Islands]] becomes an occupied territory under Nazi Germany from Italy *September 10 — The [[Kingdom of Montenegro]] becomes a protectorate under Nazi Germany from Italy *September 8 **The [[Albanian Kingdom (1939–1943)|Albanian Kingdom]] becomes a protectorate of Nazi Germany from Italy *September — The [[French West Indies|French Antilles and Guiana]] is split into [[French Guiana]], [[Guadeloupe]], [[Inini]], [[Martinique]], and [[Saint Pierre and Miquelon]] *August 15 — [[Kiska]] is taken over by allied forces *August 1 — [[Japanese occupation of Burma|Burma]] is given independence under Japanese occupation as the [[State of Burma]] *July 30 — The [[Shanghai French Concession]] and the [[Concessions in Tianjin#French concession (1860-1946)|Tianjin French Concession]] are taken over by Japan *June 26 — The [[Nazi Germany|German Reich]] is officially renamed the [[Nazi Germany|Greater German Reich]] *May 30 — [[Attu Island]] is taken back over by the [[Libreville]] and [[Bangui]] yield to [[Brazzaville]] as the capital. |} =====1919===== [[File:Map of Bulgaria after Treaty of Neuilly-sur-Seinе-en.svg|thumb|Territory ceded by Bulgaria in the Treaty of Neuilly-sur-Seine]] *November 27 — Bulgaria signs the [[Treaty of Neuilly-sur-Seine]]: **[[Western Thrace]] is ceded to the [[Allies of World War I|Entente]] **The Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes is recognized and a small amount of land along the western border is ceded to it **Dobruja is given to Romania *September 25 — [[Spitsbergen]] awarded to Norway [[File:Dissolution of Austria-Hungary.png|thumb|New borders of the states formed by the dissolution of Austria-Hungary]] *September 12 - Bonin-Pichon agreement transfers two desert strips from French control to [[Italian Libya]]. *September 10 — Austria signs [[Treaty of Saint Germain]]: **Cedes [[Eastern Galicia]] to Poland **Cedes [[South Tyrol]], [[Trentino]], Trieste and [[Istria]] to Italy **Recognizes the independence of Hungary, [[Second Polish Republic|Poland]], Czechoslovakia, and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats, and Slovene *July 10 — France and the United Kingdom agree on frontier between their mandates in the Cameroons [[File:German losses after WWI.svg|thumb|German losses as a result of the treaty of Versailles.]] [[File:London-geographical-institute the-peoples-atlas 1920 poland-and-the-new-baltic-states.jpg|thumb|Poland and the Baltic states after the Treaty of Versailles.]] *June 28 — The [[Treaty of Versailles]] and [[Little Treaty of Versailles]]: **[[Eupen-Malmedy]] and [[Neutral Moresnet]] ceded to Belgium **Alsace-Lorraine officially ceded to France **[[Second Polish Republic]] is established in place of the puppet [[Kingdom of Poland (1916–18)|Kingdom of Poland]]. Most of [[Province of Posen|Posen]] and West Prussia ceded to Poland by Germany. **[[Klaipėda Region|Memel]] and [[Saarland]] under international administration **Provides for plebiscites in Schleswig and Upper Silesia **[[Gdańsk|Danzig]] and surrounding area becomes a semi-autonomous city-state under the name [[Free City of Danzig]], administered by the [[League of Nations]] *May 30 — [[Ruanda]] and [[Urundi]] (minus Kisaka district) assigned to Belgium as a mandate *May 7 — [[German New Guinea]] and the [[Bismarck Archipelago]] assigned to Australia as a mandate *May 7 — [[German Southwest Africa]] assigned to South Africa as a mandate *May 7 — [[German Samoa]] assigned to New Zealand as a mandate *May 7 — German Northern Pacific islands assigned to Japan as a mandate *May 7 — Nauru assigned to British Empire (eventually UK, Australia, and NZ) as a mandate *May 6 — [[Kionga Triangle]] assigned to Portugal as a mandate *May 6 — [[Kamerun]] and [[Togoland]] assigned to France and the United Kingdom as mandates *May 1 — End of Soviet republic in Bavaria *April 19 — Polish occupation of Vilna, disputed by the Lithuanians *April 4 — [[Bavarian Council Republic|Soviet republic]] established in Bavaria *March 1 — French West Africa reorganized, with Upper Volta as a separate colony *February 1 — The Soviet puppet state [[Commune of the Working People of Estonia]] loses all territory to the [[Republic of Estonia]] =====1918===== *November 29 — The puppet state [[Commune of the Working People of Estonia]] is established in [[Estonian War of Independence|Soviet-occupied]] [[Estonia]] *November 25 — [[Banat, Bačka and Baranja|Vojvodna]], formerly part of Austria-Hungary, unites with the Kingdom of Serbia *November 15 — [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] military invasion of the short-lived [[Banat Republic]], [[Banat]] divided between the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Kingdom of Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes]] and [[Romania]] *November 12 — [[Republic of German-Austria]] (unrecognized) declared *November 1 **Declaration of the short-lived [[Banat Republic]] **Declaration of the short-lived [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] *March 3 — The [[Treaty of Brest-Litovsk]] creates many new states out of the western [[Russian Empire]] =====1917===== *April 12 — The [[Autonomous Governorate of Estonia]] is created from the [[Governorate of Estonia]] and some of the [[Governorate of Livonia]] of the [[Russian Empire]]. *March 31 — The [[United States]] takes possession of the [[United States Virgin Islands]] ([[Danish West Indies]]) according to the terms of the [[Treaty of the Danish West Indies]]. =====1914===== *April 17 - Tannu Uriankhai is officially made a protectorate of Russia. =====1913===== Treaty of Constantinople (1913) September 29 **The Ottoman Empire regains the portions of [[Eastern Thrace]] it lost in the [[First Balkan War]] **The [[Balkan League]] gain all Ottoman territory west of a line joining [[Enez]] and [[Kıyıköy]] (thus the Ottomans lose all their European territory, except for what is roughly the southeastern half of Turkey's present-day European territory). Treaty of Bucharest (1913) August 10 **Bulgaria gains [[Western Thrace]] and the southern portions of what are now [[Blagoevgrad Province]] and [[Burgas Province]] **Romania gains [[Southern Dobruja]]. **Serbia gains [[Kosovo]], most of what is now the [[Republic of Macedonia]], and some new land to the west of its previous borders. **Greece gains [[Epirus]], [[West Macedonia]], [[Central Macedonia]], and most of the islands in the Aegean that it did not control before the war. **Albania gains southern, eastern, and northern lands that bring it to its current borders. **Albania becomes officially independent, though a large portion of its lands are disputed **Montenegro gains most of what is now its [[Regions of Montenegro|Northern Region]] *February 13 — [[Tibet (1912-1951)|Tibet]] declares independence from the [[Republic of China (1912-1949)|Republic of China]] =====1912===== *November 27 - [[Treaty Between France and Spain Regarding Morocco]] assigns the northern and southern strips of Morocco to Spain. *March 30 - [[Treaty of Fez]] makes Morocco formally a French Protectorate. =====1911===== * November 4 - Germany acquires the [[Neukamerun]] region from France, in exchange for dropping German claims in Morocco, in the "[[Morocco–Congo Treaty]]" ====1900s==== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !style="width:6%"|Year||style="width:8%"|Date||style="width:86%"|Event |- |style="text-align:center;" |1909||align=center|July 9|| style="background:#fee;"|The [[Rattanakosin Kingdom|Kingdom of Siam]] transfers its southernmost provinces to '''[[British Malaya]]''' in the [[Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909]]. |- | rowspan="3" style="text-align:center;" |1908||align=center|November 15|| style="background:#dfd;"|King [[Leopold II of Belgium]] sells his private [[Congo Free State]] to the [[Kingdom of Belgium]]. Paris remains the capital. |- |align=center|March 16|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[United Kingdom of the Netherlands]]''' supersedes the [[Sovereign Principality of the United Netherlands]]. [[Amsterdam]] and [[Brussels]] are the joint capitals. |- | || style="background:#fee;"|[[Sir Robert Brownrigg]] establishes the '''[[Crown Colony of Ceylon]]'''. [[Colombo]] becomes the capital. |- | || style="background:#ffd;"|The capital of [[Bermuda]] is moved from [[St. George, Bermuda|St George]] to [[Hamilton, Bermuda|Hamilton]] |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="11"|1814||align=center|November 4|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Kingdom of Norway (1814)|Kingdom of Norway]] joins a''' [[union between Sweden and Norway|personal union]]''' with the [[Sweden|Kingdom of Sweden]]. [[Stockholm]] and [[Oslo|Christiania]] are the capitals. |- |align=center|October 2|| style="background:#fed;"|The '''[[Monarchy of Spain]]''' reconquers [[Chile]]. |- |align=center|May 17|| style="background:#eef;"|Norway declares full independence, electing its own king and adopting its own constitution. |- |align=center|April 11|| style="background:#eef;"|Napoleon abdicates from the [[Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic)|Italian]] throne, effectively dissolving the Kingdom. |- |align=center|April 6|| style="background:#eef;"|The restored '''[[Bourbon Restoration|Kingdom of France]]''' supersedes the [[First French Empire]]. [[Paris]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|March 29|| style="background:#eef;"|The Netherlands are reestablished from France as the [[Sovereign Princedom of the Netherlands]]. |- |align=center|May 17|| style="background:#eef;"|Denmark cedes Norway to Sweden through the [[peace of Kiel]]. |- | || style="background:#eef;"|Various Italian states are reinstated, including the [[Duchy of Modena and Reggio]] and the [[Papal States]]. |- |align=center|May 17|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Kingdom of Sardinia]] reclaims its mainland territory and annexes the land of the former [[Republic of Genoa]]. (Ratified by the Congress of Vienna in 1815.) |- |align=center|January 14|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Kingdom of Norway (1814)|Kingdom of Norway]]''' secedes [[Denmark–Norway]]. [[Oslo|Christiania]] is the capital. |- ||| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Principality of Andorra]]''' declares independence from the [[First French Empire]]. [[Andorra la Vella]] is the capital. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="6"|1813||align=center|December 11|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Treaty of Valençay]] ends formally the [[Peninsular War]], with the restoration of [[Ferdinand VII of Spain]] and releasing the country from being a [[client state]] of the Napoleonic [[First French Empire|French Empire]]. |- |align=center|December 2|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Sovereign Principality of the United Netherlands]]''' is created from the ruins of the first [[French First Empire|French Empire]]. [[Amsterdam]] is the capital. |- |align=center|October 19|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Confederation of the Rhine]]''' dissolves. |- |align=center|October 12|| style="background:#fed;"|[[Paraguay]] becomes the '''[[Republic of Paraguay]]'''. [[Asunción]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|August 7|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Second Republic of Venezuela]] is declared |- |align=center|July 23|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[United Kingdom|British]] '''[[Malta Colony]]''' supersedes the [[Malta Protectorate]]. [[Valletta]] remains the capital. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"|1812||align=center|July 28|| style="background:#fed;"|The [[First Republic of Venezuela]] is crushed by the [[Spanish Empire]] |- |align=center|May 28|| style="background:#eef;"|The eastern portion of the [[Principality of Moldavia]] ([[Bessarabia]]) is ceded to the Russian Empire by the Ottoman Empire in the [[Treaty of Bucharest, 1812|Treaty of Bucharest]] |- |align=center|May 14|| style="background:#eef;"|[[First French Empire|France]] annexes [[Catalonia]] from Spain, creating the départements of [[Bouches-de-l'Èbre]], [[Montserrat (department)|Montserrat]], [[Sègre (department)|Sègre]] and [[Ter (department)|Ter]]. [[Andorra]] is also annexed and incorporated into the département of Sègre. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|1811||align=center|November 27|| style="background:#fed;"|The [[United Provinces of New Granada]] (modern [[Colombia]]) are established |- |align=center|July 5|| style="background:#fed;"|[[Venezuela]] declares independence from Spain |- |align=center|May 14|| style="background:#fed;"|'''[[Paraguay]]''' gains independence from the [[Monarchy of Spain]]. [[Asunción]] is the capital. |- |align=center|March 28|| style="background:#ffd;"|The '''[[Kingdom of Haiti]]''' supersedes the [[State of Haiti]]. [[Cap-Haïtien]] is the capital. |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan="10"|1810||align=center|December 13|| style="background:#eef;"|France annexes northern Germany ([[Hamburg]], [[Bremen]], [[Free City of Lübeck|Lübeck]], [[Principality of Salm|Salm]], [[Arenberg]], [[Duchy of Oldenburg|Oldenburg]], parts of [[Kingdom of Westphalia|Westphalia]] and [[Berg (state)#French revolution, Grand Duchy of Berg|Berg]]) |- |align=center|September 18|| style="background:#fed;"|'''[[Chile]]''' declares its independence from the [[Monarchy of Spain]]. [[Santiago, Chile|Santiago]] is the capital. |- |align=center|September 16|| style="background:#ffd;"|'''[[México]]''' declares its independence from the [[Monarchy of Spain]]. |- |align=center|July 20|| style="background:#fed;"|'''[[Colombia]]''' declares its independence from the [[Monarchy of Spain]]. |- |align=center|July 13|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Kingdom of Holland]] ([[Netherlands]]) is annexed by the first '''[[French First Empire|French Empire]]'''. |- |align=center|May 25|| style="background:#fed;"|[[May Revolution]]. The Spanish viceroy in the [[Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata]] ([[Argentina]], [[Bolivia]], [[Paraguay]], and [[Uruguay]]) is replaced by the [[Primera Junta]]. Creation of the '''[[United Provinces of the Río de la Plata]]'''. [[Buenos Aires]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|May 22|| style="background:#eef;"|By the terms of the [[Treaty of Paris (1810)|Treaty of Paris]], the [[Principality of Regensburg]] is formally incorporated into the [[Kingdom of Bavaria]] |- |align=center|April 19|| style="background:#fed;"|The [[First Republic of Venezuela]] is established, starting the [[Venezuelan War of Independence]] from [[Spain]] |- |align=center|April|| style="background:#eff;"|[[Kamehameha I]] unifies the '''[[Kingdom of Hawaiʻi]]'''. |- | || style="background:#eef;"|The [[Rhodanic Republic]] is annexed by France and becomes the département of [[Simplon (department)|Simplon]] |} ====1800s==== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !style="width:6%"|Year||style="width:8%"|Date||style="width:86%"|Event |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="7"|1809|| style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|October 14|| style="background:#eef;"|[[Salzburg]] is ceded to Bavaria ([[Treaty of Schönbrunn]]) |- | style="background:#eef;"|[[West Galicia]] is ceded to the [[Duchy of Warsaw]] ([[Treaty of Schönbrunn]]) |- | style="background:#eef;"|[[Tarnopol]] is ceded to the Russian Empire ([[Treaty of Schönbrunn]]) |- | style="background:#eef;"|[[Trieste]] and [[Croatia]] south of the [[Sava]] are ceded to France; these become the [[Illyrian provinces]] ([[Treaty of Schönbrunn]]) |- |align=center|September 17|| style="background:#eef;"|Sweden officially cedes Finland to Russia through the [[peace of Hamina]] |- |align=center|March 29|| style="background:#eef;"|The Russian Tsar is declared Grand-duke of Finland, effectively separating Finland from Sweden and turning it into a Russian autonomous duchy |- | || style="background:#eef;"|Napoleon dissolves the [[Teutonic Knights]]; their lands are redistributed between neighboring states of the Holy Roman Empire, mostly to [[Württemberg]]. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|1808||align=center|March 7|| style="background:#fed;"|The '''[[Kingdom of Portugal and the Algarves]]''' removes the capital from [[Lisbon]] to exile in [[Rio de Janeiro, Brazil]]. |- | || style="background:#eef;"|[[Spain]] becomes a [[client state]] of the [[First French Empire]] after the country was partially occupied by French forces and [[Joseph Bonaparte|Joseph I]] set as king by [[Napoleon Bonaparte|Napoleon]]. |- |align=center|1807||align=center|July|| style="background:#eef;"|Napoleon creates the [[Duchy of Warsaw]] from land ceded by the [[Kingdom of Prussia]] by the [[Treaties of Tilsit]] |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"|1806||align=center|October 17|| style="background:#ffd;"|The [[First Empire of Haiti|Empire of Haiti]] collapses upon the assassination of [[Jean-Jacques Dessalines|Emperor Jacques I]]. [[Frankfurt]] is the capital. |- |align=center|June 5|| style="background:#eef;"|The '''[[Kingdom of Holland]]''' ([[Netherlands]]) supersedes the [[Batavian Republic]]. [[Amsterdam]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|January 8|| style="background:#dfd;"|The [[United Kingdom]] establishes the '''[[Cape Colony]]'''. [[Cape Town]] is the capital. |- |align=center|1805||align=center|July|| style="background:#eef;"|France annexes the [[Principality of Piombino]] and the [[Republic of Lucca]] and reconstitutes them as the [[Principality of Lucca and Piombino]] |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"|1804||align=center|September 22|| style="background:#ffd;"|[[Jean-Jacques Dessalines]] establishes the '''[[First Empire of Haiti|Empire of Haiti]]'''. [[Port-au-Prince]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|August 11|| style="background:#eef;"|[[Francis II, Holy Roman Emperor]], establishes the '''[[Austrian Empire]]'''. [[Vienna]] is the capital. |- |align=center|May 18|| style="background:#eef;"|The first '''[[French First Empire|French Empire]]''' supersedes the first [[French First Republic|French Republic]]. [[Paris]] remains the capital. |- |align=center|March 4|| style="background:#ffd;"|The [[French First Republic|French Republic]] [[Louisiana Purchase|sells]] '''[[Louisiana (New France)|Louisiane]]''' to the [[United States of America]]. [[New Orleans]] ([[Nouvelle-Orléans]]) is the capital of the unorganized territory. |- |align=center|January 1|| style="background:#ffd;"|The French colony of [[Saint-Domingue]] on [[Hispaniola]] declares its independence from the [[French First Republic|French Republic]] as '''[[Haiti]]'''. [[Port-au-Prince]] remains the capital. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|1803||align=center|April 27|| style="background:#eef;"|As a result of the [[Reichsdeputationshauptschluss]], all but three ([[Archbishopric of Regensburg]], and the lands of the [[Teutonic Knights]] and [[Knights of Saint John]]) ecclesiastical states of the Holy Roman Empire are either secularized or annexed by other states. The [[Duchy of Salzburg]] (formerly the [[Archbishopric of Salzburg]]) is also raised to an [[prince-elector|electorate]]. |- |align=center|February 19|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Act of Mediation]] converts the Helvetic Republic into the [[Swiss Confederation (Napoleonic)|Swiss Confederation]] |- |align=center|1802|| || style="background:#eef;"|Napoleon separates the Canton of Valais from the Helvetic Republic to form the [[Rhodanic Republic]] |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|1801||align=center|August 20|| style="background:#eef;"|'''[[Gozo (independent state)|The Gozitan Nation]]''' is annexed by the [[Malta Protectorate|British protectorate of Malta]]. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|June 6|| style="background:#fed;"|The [[Kingdom of Spain]] and the [[Kingdom of Portugal]] signs the [[Treaty of Badajoz (1801)|Treaty of Badajoz]]. Spain cedes the South American '''[[Misiones Orientales]]''' to Portugal. |- | style="background:#eef;"|The [[Kingdom of Spain]] and the [[Kingdom of Portugal]] signs the [[Treaty of Badajoz (1801)|Treaty of Badajoz]]. Portugal cedes '''[[Olivenza]]''' to Spain. |- |align=center|January 1|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Kingdom of Great Britain]] and the [[Kingdom of Ireland]] unite to form the '''[[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland]]'''. [[Dublin]] yields to [[London]] as the capital. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="3"|1800||align=center|November 17|| style="background:#ffd;"|The '''[[United States of America]]''' moves its capital from [[Philadelphia]] to its permanent location at [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]] in the [[Washington, D.C.|District of Columbia]]. |- |align=center|September 5|| style="background:#eef;"|French forces in [[French occupation of Malta|Malta]] surrender to the British. The island becomes the '''[[Malta Protectorate|British protectorate of Malta]]''' with [[Valletta]] as capital. |- |align=center|October 1|| style="background:#ffd;"|After a secretly negotiated treaty between France and Spain, Spain returns the colony of Louisiana to France |- |align=center|1800||align=center|February 17|| style="background:#eef;"|The French département of [[Mont-Terrible]] is merged into the département of [[Haut-Rhin]]. |} ===18th Century=== ====1790s==== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !style="width:6%"|Year||style="width:8%"|Date||style="width:86%"|Event |- |align=center|1799||align=center|July 7|| style="background:#fee;"|Establishment of the [[Sikh Empire]] after capture of [[Lahore]] by [[Ranjit Singh|Maharaja Ranjit Singh]] and unification of the [[Sikh Confederacy]] under him. |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|1798||align=center|October 28|| style="background:#eef;"|'''[[Gozo (independent state)|The Gozitan Nation]]''' gains ''de facto'' independence from [[French occupation of Malta|Malta]] with [[Victoria, Gozo|Rabat]] as its capital. |- |align=center|June 11|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Knights Hospitaller|Order of Saint John]] capitulates to French forces and '''[[Malta]]''' is under [[French occupation of Malta|French occupation]] with [[Valletta]] remaining the capital. |- |align=center|April 12|| style="background:#eef;"|The Napoleonic [[Helvetic Republic]] is declared |- |align=center|January 4|| style="background:#eef;"|France annexes [[Mulhouse]] |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan="5"|1797||align=center|April 17|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[House of Habsburg]] annexes the '''[[Republic of Venice]]'''. |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan="4"|October 18|| style="background:#eef;"|The [[Austrian Netherlands]] and various Mediterranean islands, including [[Corfu]], are ceded to France. ([[Treaty of Campo Formio]]) |- | style="background:#eef;"|The [[Republic of Venice]] is dissolved. [[Kingdom of Portugal]] signs the [[Treaty of Madrid (13 January 1750)|Treaty of Madrid]]. Based on the ''uti possidetis'' concept, Portugal gains lands on the actual south, central and north regions of Brazil. The treaty also stipulated that Spain would receive the [[Colonia del Sacramento]] and Portugal the [[Misiones Orientales]]. |} ====1740s==== {|class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !style="width:6%"|Year||style="width:8%"|Date||style="width:86%"|Event |- |style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|1747|||| style="background:#fee;"|[[Safavid Empire]] collapsesBeck, Roger et al.(2008). |align=center|1495||align=center|June 7|| style="background:#ffd;"|Representatives of the [[Kingdom of Spain]] and the [[Kingdom of Portugal]] sign the [[Treaty of Tordesillas]], settling the [[Azores]] (approximately 38°11' west of [[Prime meridian|Greenwich]].) |- |align=center|1492||align=center|October 12|| style="background:#ffd;"|While seeking a route to the [[East Indies]], [[Genoa|Genoese]] navigator ''[[Christopher Columbus|Cristoforo Colombo]]'' (Christopher Columbus) lands on the island of [[Guanahani]] in the [[Lucayan Archipelago]], which he mistakes for the [[Japanese Archipelago]]. Columbus claims the archipelago for his patrons the Crowns of [[Crown of Castile|Castile]] and [[Crown of Aragon|Aragon]] ([[Spain]]), and subsequently explores and claims [[Cuba]] and [[Hispaniola]].
